121001.name: Fantail Athletism
121001.description:
Board Game based on Athletic Disciplines

You will enjoy a real board game where athletic events are simulated on a track and field. Such as 100/200/400 metres, 110 metres hurdles, 4x100 metres, long, high and triple jump, and throwing events including: javelin, hammer discus and shot put.
The goal is to achieve the highest score in the different athletic disciplines that are considered before the event.

The board represents the field and running track. On the track disciplines are developed throws and jumps, and on the track racing. The players will use 2/5 dice of different colors, depending on how many of the same discipline to develop. Difficulties in the disciplines are taken into account with one of the dice to use. In each discipline each player (athlete) will move its piece on the board in the room or location that corresponds to the number thrown with the dice and thereby indicate the regulations in each discipline.

The player who collected the most points at the end of the disciplines developed will be the winner of the competition.

121002.name: Sgrizam
121002.description:
User Summary

25th Century. Warriors from the planet Kindos have attacked Earth, kidnapped princess Doxaphin and stolen the Imperial Treasure. Armed with your mighty sword Sgrizam, you must rescue the princess and recover the treasure.

The game is a side-scrolling beat'em up. The player must travel through four levels while battling or dodging monsters to get to the princess.

121003.name: Good Friends & Fine Spirits
121003.description:
From Introduction:

Good Friends & Fine Spirits is a mini site-based adventure for characters ranging from 2nd- 4th level of ability and is designed for The Hunt: Rise of Evil campaign setting. However, it is easily adaptable to any d20 fantasy game. This will also demonstrate the general layout and quality of the adventures you can expect from Mystic Eye Games.

121004.name: The White Witch
121004.description:
From Introduction:

The White Witch is probably the least understood Class in Dunreth or maybe all the world. The Pantheon considers these terrible Pagans to be only one step above their evil counterparts. Feeling that they could be to easily swayed to evil ways. Witches are really a cross between Clerics and Sorcerers. Their magic is derived from both the old, pagan gods they worship and the mana of the world. There are many types of
Witches, and gods that they worship. Here you will find generic rules you can apply to the various types of worship there is for white witches. You will also find two examples from The Hunt: Rise of Evil Campaign setting. Their spells tend to be that of divination and healing. They brew potions and can lay on some powerful curses. Generally, white witches will tend not to use curses unless they are in a dire situation. It is their very ability to curse others that has allowed the Pantheon to sway the people of the world against them in many countries.

121005.name: What The...?: The Wanderers Guild Guide to Absurd Monstrosities
121005.description:
From Introduction:

Greetings, friend. Welcome to What The...?: The Wanderers Guild Guide to Absurd Monstrostiies. This book continues the Wanderers Guild Series, a collection of guidebooks designed to be of value to players and game masters alike. The books in the Wanderers Guild Series are unique in that they are presented exclusively from the viewpoint of an actual member of the Wanderers Guild, a fantasy league of explorers, adventurers, artists and academics.

Game stats for the d20 game system have been provided in relevant sidebars for each entry. Because the book is written from the points of various wanderers, no game terms have been used in the actual body of the text, allowing the book to be used as a prop during play. Simply cover the sidebars with a folded sheet of paper and the book can be read by players without concern that they will learn secret game information.

121006.name: Marvel Heroic Roleplaying: Basic Game
rpghonor: 2012 ENnie for Best Game - Silver Winner
2012 ENnie for Best Rules - Gold Winner
2012 ENnie for Product of the Year - Silver Winner
2012 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2013 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2013 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee
2013 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Winner
rpgpodcastepisode: Cam Banks talks Marvel Heroic Roleplaying Release!
Marvel Heroic Roleplaying Ready for Release (just about)
Marvel Heroic RPG Actual Play Session 1
121006.description:
From the back of the book:


IT’S TIME TO STEP UP

The Avengers have been disassembled, the Fantastic Four are somewhere in space, and the X-Men aren’t answering their phone. When dozens of dangerous villains are sprung from the maximum-maximum security prison known as the Raft, who’s going to stop them? You are.


ALL THE RULES, ALL THE ACTION

Experience all of the pulse-pounding action and nail-biting drama of the Marvel Universe at your gaming table. It’s one thing to stop an alien invasion or throw down with the Juggernaut, but sometimes you’ve got to make the hard choices—will you let a dangerous villain escape in order to save an innocent life?. With the MARVEL HEROIC ROLEPLAYING Basic Game, that great power and great responsibility is yours.

This Rulebook Includes:

Operations Manual: Easy to learn game rules for playing characters from the Marvel Universe and playing out your favorite Marvel Blockbuster Events!
Breakout: Based on the acclaimed story arc from Brian Michael Bendis’ New Avengers, including a super villain prison break and a perilous journey to the Savage Land!
Hero Datafiles: Game play sheets for many of your favorite Marvel Super Heroes, from Captain America and Spider-Man to the X-Men and Fantastic Four!




For two to eight players, ages 13 and up. Requires game dice.

121007.description:
Thunderstone Avatars is a 25-card expansion – five copies of five different cards – that adds variable player powers to Thunderstone. The cards in detail are:


Cleric


Village: Draw 1 card for each disease present.
Spoils: Discard 1 XP to destroy 1 card.


Fighter


Weapons weigh 1 point less.
Dungeon: One weapon is considered equipped, even if you do not have a hero to equip it. You may use the abilities and traits of that weapon.


Ranger


Dungeon: Switch the positions of 2 adjacent monsters in the hall.
Dungeon: Reveal the top card of the dungeon deck. You may attack this as if it were 1 rank deeper than the monster in the last rank.


Thief


You can buy items and weapons for 1 fewer gold.
Dungeon: Discard 2 XP to have each other player discard a card.


Wizard


Village: If you purchase a spell, draw an additional card when you draw a new hand.
Dungeon: If you have used a spell's ability this turn, discard 2 XP to gain Magic Attack +3.
121007.name: Thunderstone Avatars

121008.name: Anduin (Issue 66 - Nov 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Die Abenteuer von Bruno dem Banditen
121008.description: This issue conatains an Earthdawn adventure "Geteiltes Erbe" and a Gemini adventure "Die Saat des Bösen". It includes also an article about the perfect equipment.

121009.description:
Face-Off Hockey is an abstract sports game that uses unique dice and a morale point system to simulate all the exciting action of hockey.

Easy to learn and teach, even if you've never watched or played the sport.

Face-Off Hockey uses 16 unique dice. Each player will select a set of 7 that include, 4 Forwards, 2 Defencemen, and a Goalie. The dice use a straight forward color scheme making them easy to identify, with glyphs that are universally recognisable.

Fight for puck possession and attempt to generate offence in order score goals and win the game.

The morale system simulates the highs and lows that your team will encounter throughout the course of a game. Use your morale boost to perform special actions which could lead to a turning point in the game!

Track scores, turns, period and any penalties with the cleverly designed play mat.

Face-Offs, Checking, turnovers, breakaways, odd man rushes, penalties, short handed goals, overtime, shootouts and more!
121009.name: Face-Off Hockey

121010.name: Rahan: Jeu de la Préhistoire
121010.description:
Rahan is a French comics series about an intelligent prehistoric man, that appeared first as part of Pif gadget, then published in albums of 2 to 4 complete stories. It was initially written by Roger Lecureux, and after his death in 1999, by his son, Jean-François Lecureux. Most of the artwork is drawn by Andre Cheret, as well as some other artists (Enrique Romero, Zam, DeHuescar)..
In 1986, Rahan was adapted into an animated series.

The Game :
Each player have a Prehistoric cave man wich moves with movement cards.
They must reach "Fire" or "Water" area and bring them back to the cave.
They shoot at wild animals with the "silex".
They try to meet Rahan to recover an invention from him.

121011.name: Gurami: das Spiel
121011.description:
GURAMI is a collection of three games based on GURAMI PUZZLE: numbers of two colors are filled in a grid of triangles, so that in any direction the sums of both colors are equal.

EQUAL = WINS is a family game in which the players lay out pieces to construct Gurami chains. Bigger Gurami chains bring about higher scores than smaller Gurami chains.

KISSNG GURAMIS is a 2 player game in which both players have their own boards. The objection is to score more points than the opponent by placing the same pieces in a more sophisticated way.

GORAMI is a strategy game for 2 persons. Here both players have their own color. The objection isn't equal sums, but to conquer more stripes than the opponent by having higher sums of one's own gaming pieces. One tactic is to take the last liberty of an opposing piece, because then the opposing piece is turned to one's own color.

121012.description:
Objective: be the first ending your round trip through Brandenburg
- acting by turn -
1. draw a starting card & 3 places/cards you have to visit
2. form the best route connecting these places
3. travel along this route, draw (travel) cards (and use them to speed up), follow instructions (if any), read statements of places (sightseeing)...
121012.name: Das große Brandenburg-Spiel

121013.name: Anduin (Issue 67 - Dec 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Die Abenteuer von Bruno dem Banditen
Dinge, die ein Magier von seinem Lehrling nicht zu hören wünscht
Große Filme, kleine Zauberer und das liebe Geld
121013.description: This issue contains the Shadowrun adventure "Ein ungewöhnliches Geschenk" and the Gemini adventure "Das Herz einer Schwester".

121014.name: Was ist Was Deutschland Quiz
121014.description:
Objective:
get most question cards finding correct answers
- acting by turns -
draw a card and give the correct answer;
if you are right keep card as bonus point
content:
64 question- & answer cards (backside), wide range (geography, people, politics, history...)
remarks:
supplemented/enhanced by 16 different, German federal states related editions

121015.description:
Who will you invite to tea? Be careful who you invite as sometimes the characters will disappear as soon as they arrive!

In Tea Time, players collect characters from Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland, and each character card (other than Alice) is double-sided, with a normal image on one side and a reverse "mirrored" image on the other. Each round, an array of characters is laid out, with normal and mirrored images alternating. The round's start player takes one character, adds it to his collection, then places the Alice card in that spot of the array. The next player takes 1-2 cards, but if he takes two, the cards must be adjacent. From the third player on, each player takes 1-3 cards; again, you can take multiple cards only if they're adjacent. If you ever have a normal and a mirrored image of the same character in your collection, *poof* they both disappear.

After five rounds (with two players) or three rounds (with 3-4 players), the game ends. Players score 1-15 points for collecting 1-5 cards of the same character – with zero cards of a character being worth five points, so sometimes you do want them to vanish! Alice herself is worth four points, and whoever has the most points wins.
121015.name: Tea Time
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 336 - Qin, HomeStretch, and Tea Time

121016.description:
Wings of Glory: WW1 Airplane Packs are single-plane blister packs with one 1/144 model plane, assembled and painted, and its deck of maneuver cards.

The first series includes Fokker E.III, Halberstadt D.III, Morane-Saulnier and Airco D.H.2, each one in three different color schemes.

New planes are available! The four famous fighters of the types first released as Wings of War miniatures have recently reached the stores. Now you can put the SPAD 13 and Albatros D-V through their paces, or restage the most famous competitions of the war with the Fokker Triplane versus the Sopwith Camel. These pairs are available as "Duel packs" that include rules an the bits needed to play. Or, you can by them individually. Single packs reprise a few of the original paint schemes (including the all-red Tripe!) and offer new paint schemes as well.
121016.name: Wings of Glory: WW1 Airplane Packs
boardgameaccessory: Wings of Glory: 100 additional flight stands
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

121017.name: Conquête de la Mer
121017.description:
The goal of the game is to discover the sea during a large rally on the oceans. Each player must complete five missions by moving on the game board of unequal difficulties and bringing the witnesses in its home port.

In his turn, players must correctly answer questions to win the cards and to collect one of each family.

121018.description:
A single promo card expansion for Ca$h 'n Gun$, selling through Geek Store.

Exchange your gun for the Shotgun.

From now on, you can either aim at one player, or between 2 players.
If you aimed at only one person you play as if it you had a normal gun.
If you aim between 2 players, both are threatened by your gun. If you reveal a bullet (“Bang!” Or “Bang Bang Bang!” take a wound marker for each target and flip them. If none of the markers shows a wound, your old shotgun is jammed. Nobody is hurt and you take your Bang! (or Bang! Bang! Bang!) card back, and throw away one of your remaining “Click” cards instead.

Revealed: Before any round.
121018.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Size Doesn't Matter

121019.name: 3D Starstrike
videogamehonor: 1984 Golden Joystick Best Arcade-Style Game of the Year Nominee
121019.description:
User Summary

3D Starstrike is a wireframe 3D shoot'em up heavily inspired by the first Star Wars movies. Each level has 3 phases: first a space battle with enemy fighters, then a ground attack sequence against defense bunkers and towers, and finally the "equatorial duct run" sequence, where the player must dodge catwalks and flak while flying along the duct. At the end of the duct is the power station that must be destroyed. Once destroyed, the player proceeds to the next level.

Each hit reduces the player's spacecraft's shields, and the laser guns need time to cool down so the player can't fire at everything.

121020.name: Dominator
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121020.description:
User Summary

Earth has been engulfed by a predator of galactic proportions. It is slowly being digested; only you, the Dominator, can get rid of the creature by flying your ship deep into the enemy's organism, find the weak spots and destroy them.

Dominator is a shoot'em up with alternating top-down and side-view scrolling levels. The game has many different enemies, and the player can collect power-ups to upgrade the ship's weapons.

121021.name: Austria Stands Alone: The 1809 Campaign
121021.description:
[from back of cover]
...is a Volley & Bayonet scenario book covering the famous campaign of 1809. It provides:

- historical background on the five battles of Sacile, Piave, Raab, Aspern-Essling & Wagram.
- complete scenarios for all five battles.
- a rules update to refine Volley & Bayonet for Napoleonic Warfare.
- an extensive look at all the armies and their uniforms.
- a complete order of battle for each battle and the campaign, and for each scenario an army roster for ease of play.
- a point system to allow you to design you own scenarios.
- 10 maps, one for each battlefield and one for the troop deployment.

Volley & Bayonet is the most practical way to fight the great campaigns of 1809. Find out if Napoleon will suffer his first defeat or even his last great victory!

121022.name: Disney's Peter Pan: Return to Never Land
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121022.description:
User Summary

Disney's Peter Pan: Return to Never Land is based on Disney's sequel movie to the orginal Peter Pan animated film. The game is a 2D platformer with 7 levels, 2 mini games, and supports password save.

121023.name: Earth & Beyond
121023.description:
User Summary

Take on one of six roles in this post-war, in-space science-fiction setting. Explore space, fight space-born creatures, and manufacture ship components for sale. Earn experience in 3 areas to unlock new abilities and ship designs.

121024.name: Zatch Bell! Electric Arena
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121024.description:
User Summary

Zatch Bell! Electric Arena is a 2D fighting that lets you play as your favorite Zatch Bell characters.

121025.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Global warming threatens Vanuatu. Many islands are in danger of disappearing under the sea due to rising waters. Players will therefore have to unite to protect the islands by building dikes. However, the interests of one are not necessarily the interests of others."

Vanuatu: The Rising Waters, the first extension for Vanuatu, adds an option (as part of the Build action) for players to build dikes to protect islands from rising waters. Water can reduce a player's points from houses, submerge an island completely, and even end the game early with no winner.
121025.name: Vanuatu: The Rising Waters

121026.name: Découvrons la France
121026.description:
Similar to Voyage en France.

Instead of receiving all destination cards in start of the game player draws a next card if he reaches one of destinations.

The players have to move along the board by throwing a die.
First player who has visited 5 destination cities and arrives back in the Paris wins the game.

121028.name: Gunfright
121028.description:
User Summary

Gunfright is an isometric 3D arcade adventure game. As the town's Sheriff, you must track down famous gunslingers, shoot them down and collect the bounties. The game includes exploration phases, where the sheriff travel across town looking for his target, and gun duel sequences once the enemy is found. The amount of money earned is the player's score.

121029.name: Monster Wars
121029.description:
They've been hunted for gold and experience for years, and now its time for revenge! Take command of over 50 Monsters, in a perfect blend of Castle Defense, Hack and Slash action and RPG. Build-up a powerful Monster Army and conquer the land of Legendaria! I'ts time for the Monsters to have their revenge.

Monster Wars is universal for iPhone and iPad with support for seamless device sharing.

Source: The Developer Website.

121030.name: Gun Fu: Stickman Edition
121030.description:
User Summary

Gun Fu: is the ultimate test of skill and reflex game. Your goal is to kill as many hoards of enemies as you can. Each enemy is harder than the last one.

The game features great cartoonish graphics.

121031.description:
New from the father of VPG's Napoleonic 20 series, renowned game designer Joseph Miranda, the von Clausewitz series brings you the great campaigns of what historians call "The Long 19th Century" -- that period between the French Revolution and World War 1. The series seeks to faithfully demonstrate how war was thought about and waged during this epoch. It features quick, streamlined gameplay, simple but not simplistic mechanics, card play, and the fog of war.

Unique to the series, and following the theories of Clausewitz himself, players must be aware that many of their actions will build Friction Points -- which a wily opponent can then use against them to sabotage their best laid plans. Careful management of reserves and reinforcements, clever card play, and knowing when to throw caution to the wind to strike at an opponent will win the day.

The first game in the von Clausewitz series is Franco-Prussian War 40. Two continental heavyweights duel for supremacy in the conflict that smashed the French Second Empire, triggered the Paris Commune, and birthed the German Reich, with fateful consequences for Europe and the world. The German player must strike fast while holding the advantage in numbers, careful not to overextend his forces and put his tenuous supply lines at risk. The French player must seek to hold off the initial German invasion and defend Paris until he can unleash the Republican forces of the Third Republic. Will the war end in the streets of Paris, or Berlin? The fate of Europe hangs in the the balance!

Game Data:

Complexity: 5.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents an army, or corps (approximately 20,000-60,000 men and their equipment). Each space on the map is approximately 30 kilometers across. Each turn represents a half month of operations.
121031.name: Franco-Prussian War 40
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Gaming Gang Episode 37: Mundus Novus, Giza, Franco-Prussian War 40, and Wiz-War

121032.name: Star Hammer Tactics
121032.description:
"When Novus falls will you be its saviour?

Battle the mysterious alien Nautilids and decide the fate of the planet Novus!

Star Hammer Tactics is a fast-paced tactical battle game that anyone can learn to play in minutes. Challenge the devious AI in single player mode, or compete against friends in local multiplayer.

Achieve victory by outwitting your opponents, and blasting them to little pieces!

Source: The Game Website.

121033.name: Panda vs. Zombies
121033.description:
User Summary

In Panda vs. Zombies you take the role of Bo, he is always hungry and in his quest for food he encounter a mysterious forest with zombies. Now it is time to fight.

121034.name: Kubbuteo
121034.description:
Kubbuteo is an indoor version of popular garden game, Kubb. Players take turns flicking 6 disks the length of a 4’ by 2’ board, trying to knock down their opponent’s Kubbs [upright disks]. The opponent flicks back the downed Kubbs and then have their turn at flicking the 6 disks at the Kubbs. Once a player has knocked down all Kubbs in the opponent’s half, they may attempt to knock down the centrally located King and thus win the game – but doing this beforehand will result in losing the game, so care must be taken.
Kubbuteo can be played by people of all ages and appeals to players of Crokinole and Carrom, requiring the same dexterity skills. Tactically it is identical to parent game Kubb, deciding where to return downed Kubbs to.

121035.name: Les dents de la pub
121035.description:
Object of the game is to obtain five budgets, four departments and one agency speaker's chair.

Players roll 2 dice moving on the game board in the "the budget route."
When you have your five budgets, You go to the circular route to win the "departments within your agency."
When you have four departments, simply drop the box "Armchair President" to win the game. Whether it budgets or departments, it is necessary to earn them by answering a questions.

121036.name: The Four Gods
121036.description:
User summary

A Japanese home-published tile/card game. The game starts with a setup of face down square tiles that have power lines on their face up side. Players choose one of the edge positions as their "exit" to empower, and take turns either turning up, rotating or echanging one of the earth tiles, with the goal of getting as many connected tiles as possible to their "exit". Once the exit has a set number of connected earth tiles, it's Sealed, and the first player to Seal four exits wins.

Players can also play cards from their hand for further effects.

121037.name: Pundits & Pollsters
121037.description:
From the RPG description here on RPGGeek:

Pundits & Pollsters is a competitive, comedic roleplaying game about politicians up to mischief and mayhem - just like real life. The rules are simple and fun!

121038.name: Project Alexandria
121038.description:
From the introduction to the book:

Project Alexandria provides rules, statistics, and suggestions for people who want to role-play time travelers in our planet’s past. Project Alexandria uses the vsM Engine which allows for fast and easy play.

121039.name: $ Fever
121039.description:
The game includes six dice whose faces are one of the letters of the name of the game in different colors.

The goal is to achieve more winning combinations after 1 or more shots.

There are 10 possible combinations ranging from 50-5000 points.

The first run must include the 6 dice you put aside the combinations you want to keep and raise the other dice. If no any combinations appear, You lose everything!

Each new launch may double the sum if it is succesful.

The winner is the first to total 5000 points.

121040.name: Demon's Revenge
121040.description:
User Summary

Merlin Junior's master has gone to a Sorcerers seminar, leaving him in charge. Everything was fine until Merlin Junior tripped over and broke four earthen jars, each containing a talisman holding the demon Trodor imprisoned. Now the demon is free and his minions roam the laboratory, and it's up to Merlin Junior to retrieve the four talismans and put them back in place.

Demon's Revenge is a classic arcade adventure game. The player must collect items to open doors, banish demons and find the talismans. Roaming demons drain energy from the character; energy can be recovered by visiting the pentagram room.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Games Magazine Best New Party Game Winner
2016 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
121041.description:
Pluckin' Pairs embodies the same spirit as the classic party game Compatibility in that you want to match images with other players in order to score points, but the game play is more free form with everyone competing individually instead of in teams.

At the start of a round, eleven images are laid out on the table. All players secretly pair off images – say, coins and a manhole cover because they're both round, or a mirror and a building because they both reflect light – and write these pairs on their player sheet. One image will be leftover as the outcast.

After everyone has finished, you compare your pairs with those of other players. If no one – or conversely if everyone – created the same pair as you, you score no points for that pair. If only some of the players created that pair, each of those players scores as many points as the number of players who record the pair. (You can optionally compare outcast images as well, scoring points based on who had the same outcast as you.) The player with the most points after a certain number of rounds wins.
121041.name: Pluckin' Pairs

121042.description:
Single-plane blisters with one 1/200 model plane, assembled and painted, and its deck of maneuver cards.

Re-Implements:

Wings of War: WW2 Airplane Packs




See Also:

Wings of Glory: WW2 Special Packs
121042.name: Wings of Glory: WW2 Airplane Packs
boardgameaccessory: Wings of Glory: 100 additional flight stands
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

121043.name: Pass-Ackwords
121043.description:
As the name suggests, Pass-Ackwords turns the long-lived game of Password on its head, with players now giving clues that they hope their "partner" will not decipher in the right way.

As in Password, four players compete in teams of two; unlike in Password, you and a member of the opposing team take turns giving clues to the remaining player on the opposing team. How this works is that the clue givers have a device that shows a list of clues. Each turn, one clue giver chooses one of the listed clues, presents it to the opposing guesser, and hopes that he presented it with the wrong intonation so that the guesser won't guess the secret code word. As the crummy clues are used up, the clues will get better and better, so your challenge as the clue giver is to quickly figure out what might give a hint to your partner without giving the thing away entirely – which again is pretty much like Password!

121044.name: Die Jagd nach dem Kristall
121044.description:
Objective: be the first bringing the treasure (to be found by you or others) back home
- moving by turn -
- there's a treasure (= crystal) - in Hamburg or elsewhere - hidden on the map (one of those flipped markers);
- roll the dice, move & find it;
- but prepare yourself in advance with counter/marker to escape (lightning) or defense/fighting ones, because your opponents are going to hunt you;
- bring it back to your starting place in order to win.
Content:
1 board, 4 meeples, 36 marker/counter, 2 dice, rule sheet

121045.name: Double Take
121045.description:
Double Take is a charades game built for two, so to speak. Each round, time willing, two players will present clues for a half-dozen familiar phrases that all have something in common. A sample category, for example, is "Something's Wrong" with the words to be guessed being divided as:


Play | Foul
In the Closet | Skeleton
Sheep | Black
Gun | Smoking


Each clue giver acts out one side of the card, and since they're facing the guessers, the phrases will be acted out in left-to-right fashion ("Black Sheep", "Smoking Gun", etc.) If someone guesses one side of the card, that player scores – but the clue givers score only after both sides of a phrase have been guessed, so they need to work together – but separately – to make their clues clear.

121046.name: T-Bird
121046.description:
User Summary

You were test driving your new Foourd T-Bird hovercar and everything was fine, until you took a wrong turn and found yourself face to face with an armada of aliens, who don't take kindly to your presence. Now you must face wave after wave of attackers in order to return home.

T-Bird is a shoot'em up in the vein of Space Harrier: the player must defeat enemy waves. Each defeated group of enemy leave behind a power-up, which gives access to better weapons. Each level ends with a boss fight.

121047.name: Un fin de semana en Madrid
121047.description:
The game board shows a map of Madrid. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Other means of transportation can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the Spanish speaking ability.

121048.name: Un fine settimana a Roma
121048.description:
The game board shows a map of Rome. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Other means of transportation can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the Italian speaking ability.

121049.name: Un week-end a Paris
121049.description:
The game board shows a map of Paris. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Additionally, taxis, buses and the tube can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the French speaking ability.

121050.name: Monopoly Live
boardgamepodcastepisode: The One About the Death and Life of Monopoly
121050.description:
Hasbro describes it as:

"Go live! In this fun version of the classic MONOPOLY game, the electronic talking tower calls the plays! With motion sensing, sound effects and even surprise mini games, the tower guides the game from start to finish while you wheel, deal and call the shots! Slide the cab around the track to take a shortcut, play a quick game and then manage your cash at the ATM. With so many things to do, the “real estate market” is more thrilling than ever!

Includes electronic talking tower, gameboard, 4 game pieces, 4 bank cards, 4 card slots, cab and track, title deed cards, 32 houses, 12 hotels, 2 “green” pieces and startup guide."

Played with an IR tower containing a camera and reflective pieces and option spaces it seem to remove the need for book keeping, dice rolling, cards. And there's no money either. Kinda like a video game version just in real life.

121051.name: Tennis Cup
videogameversion: English/French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121051.description:
User Summary

A tennis simulation game by Loriciel. It uses a horizontal split-screen display (in single player and two player mode), and includes a training mode, several options (difficulty, playing surface...), single and two player mode (either in vs or coop mode), and a character creator to create custom opponents.

121052.name: Within the Devil's Reach
121052.description:
from the back of the book

Within the Devil’s Reach is a set of three introductory adventures for Dungeon World. You are adventurers from Devil’s Reach, a little town on the backside of nowhere and people have been disappearing. To make matters worse there are a lot of new faces in town including some weirdo that the mayor brought but no one quite knows why. But the worst bit is that there is a cave, just outside of town that has been silent for years and it just started speaking.

What are you and your band of friends going to do? Find out in, Within the Devil’s Reach, the first in a series of adventure books that will take players across a wide fantasy world and pit them against pirates, dragons, mechanized undead and a god of pure reason and evil. The full adventure set, Gears of the Worm God, kicks off with a bang and ends in blood.

121053.name: Secrets of the Dark: Temple of Night
121053.description:
Your friend is a journalist who is staying in a seemingly quiet desert town. After getting involved with a story involving the dark forces, he is kidnapped by three dark priests! Now they are getting ready to sacrifice him to provide the Demon of Darkness with limitless power, and it’s up to you to stop them! Save your friend in Secrets of the Dark: Temple of Night, a challenging Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

121054.name: Metal Dead
121054.description:
Metal Dead is the first in a planned series of comedic, heavy metal influenced, apocalyptic point'n'click adventure games packed with everyone's favorite undead creatures, zombies!

This twisted tale centers on two metal-heads in the midst of a zombie invasion. After crashing their car in front of a medical research facility, they become trapped and are forced to use their wits to puzzle their way to freedom. Along the way, they must deal with a cast of characters who range from mildly deranged to completely insane.

Metal Dead is a full-length old school adventure game, featuring:

- Over 40 interactive rooms
- 17 unique, quirky characters
- 13 Achievements
- Built-in hint system
- Fully orchestrated midi soundtrack
- Extensive script packed with comedy goodness
- 5-7 hours of gameplay

Source: The Game Website.

121055.description:
Versability 'the poetry game' is a parlour game inspired by the Dictionary Game, where players complete a verse of poetry with missing line(s). The players' attempts and the genuine version are read aloud and then the players vote on which is the genuine verse.

Rather than using cards, pieces and a board, Versability is published as a book. Players need to provide paper and writing implements. Randomness is achieved by closing one's eyes and pointing at a page of options.
121055.name: Versability

121056.name: Caster Tactics
121056.description:
Player: Thomas turns the foul priest’s minions. (Rolls dice)… Yes, they all run from my righteous presence.

GM: The evil priest just grins and laughs ‘Your puny attempts to stop me are like the nuisance of gnats.’ He then uses his one Priestly Might to cancel your turning. (Reaches for dice).

Player: You can’t cancel my ability to turn.

GM: Why not? Let me look this up.

This is a familiar scene. A simple, logical progression of combat leads to the game grinding to a halt as books are opened and rules are referenced. This is particularly true when spell casters are involved. All those seemingly conflicting rules and minor variations can lead to a major headache and a stoppage of game play. Well, have no fear; your friends at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer to this problem in the form of the Combat Cards. The Combat Cards: Caster Tactics are a collection of index card-sized cards with a quick reference to some of the most common spell caster combat rules. From Countering spells, to turning, to the intricacies of touch attacks, they’re all right here. Never stop to search through a book again - with Combat Cards the rules are at your fingertips.

This set of cards contains both a set of the color cards and the printer-friendly black and white set of cards.

Note: This set does not contain the rules for any specific spell; it is instead concerned with giving the overall game rules for magic-based combat maneuvers that often confuse players such as how to turn undead, counter spell, how bonuses stack and the use of the oft-underutilized touch attack.

[Publisher Blurb]

121057.name: Ellis: Kingdom in Turmoil
121057.description:
From the back of the book:

A Kingdom in Turmoil

Good King Heinrich is dead, betrayed by his closest advisor. His three sons, quarrelsome to the end, have vowed that only one of them shall rule. How many thousands will die before a king is chosen?

Rumors tell of unrest in the border-lands, and among the recently subjugated Cordovans. Will they sit idly by while civil war rages throughout kingdom?

Religious zealots speak of the end times and whip themselves into a frenzy. Heresy is stirring right under the noses of the clergy, while church leaders bicker amongst themselves.

This is your character's world and it is crumbling down. What will you do? What will you fight for? What is worth saving and what needs to change? Who can you trust? To what lengths will you go to save a kingdom in turmoil?

A Roleplaying Game of Low-Fantasy, High-Roleplaying

Detailed character creation will inspire you to build exciting personas full of depth and history.

Quick-to-learn skill system makes jumping into a a game fast and hassle-free.

Integrated rules help players immerse themselves in their characters and encourage roleplay.

A unique combat system that focuses on movement and fast-play. Play out any fight in less than an hour!

Detailed information about the world of Ellis, its people and its customs. Saints, fantastic beasts, places and important people are all described.

The Ellis: Kingdom in Turmoil book contains everything you need (except for 4 six-sided dice) to spend countless hours roleplaying and having fun.

121058.name: Monstrous Tactics
121058.description:
Description:

Player: Azer casts Magic Missile at the carnivorous plant.

GM: The plant uses his Tremorsense to find your location and launches two tentacles at you.

Player: You can’t use Tremorsense to find me - I didn’t move.

GM: It doesn’t matter. Casting the spell counts as physical activity. Here, let me find the rule.

This is a familiar scene. A simple, logical progression of combat leads to the game grinding to a halt as books are opened and rules are referenced. This is particularly true when dealing with all the unique abilities monsters possess in combat. All those seemingly conflicting rules and minor variations can lead to a major headache and a stoppage of game play. Well, have no fear; your friends at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer to this problem in the form of the Combat Cards. The Combat Cards: Monstrous Tactics are a collection of index card-sized cards with a quick reference to some of the most common monstrous combat rules. From Improved Grab, to Tremorsense, to Breath weapons, all the most common monstrous combat abilities are right here. Never stop to search through a book again - with Combat Cards the rules are at your fingertips.

This set of cards contains both a set of the color cards and the printer-friendly black and white set of cards.

[Publisher Blurb]

121060.name: Monstrous Defenses
121060.description:
GM: The troll shrugs off your puny attacks and swipes at you with one rope-like arm.

Player: What do you mean he shrugs off my attacks? That blow should have dropped him.

GM: Well, you need to use fire or acid to kill a troll because they regenerate.

Player: What? That’s ridiculous. Just because it can regenerate doesn’t mean it can’t feel my attacks. Let me see that book (grabs for the game master’s book pile).

This is a familiar scene. Combat is running along smoothly until a strange power leads to an argument and the game grinding to a halt as books are opened and rules are referenced. This is particularly true when dealing with all the unique defenses monsters can possess. All those seemingly conflicting rules and minor variations can lead to a major headache and a stoppage of game play. Well, have no fear; your friends at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer to this problem in the form of the next expansion in our Combat Cards line. The Combat Cards: Monstrous Defenses are a collection of index card-sized cards with a quick reference to some of the most common defenses that are used by monsters. From damage reduction, to gaseous form, to regeneration, all the most common monstrous defenses are right here. Never stop to search through a book again - with Combat Cards the rules are at your fingertips.

[Publisher Blurb]

121061.name: Poisons
121061.description:
GM: The blade bites into your side and you can immediately feel something’s wrong. Give me a Fort save.

Player: (Rolls dice) OK, 23. That has to save.

GM: Your moment of weakness passes and you pull the trap out of your side. As you continue down the hall you start to feel weak again. Roll another Fort save.

Player: What, that’s insane; I already saved from the poison. Let me see that book (grabs for the game master’s book pile).

Poison - it is an essential ingredient to dungeon traps, not to mention the stock and trade of assassins and some of the more nefarious races. But more often than not its use in a game can lead to confusion and arguments as players fight over how poison works and the game master has to constantly stop and look up the effect of a specific seldom-used poison. Well, have no fear - your friends at Healing Fireball Publications are here to help with our latest product, Combat Cards: Poisons. In this set of cards you will find both the traditional Combat Cards-style cards that explain the various rules involved in the use of poison. But this set contains so much more: one card for each of the poisons listed in the SRD. As an added bonus to this set we also provide 4 blank poison cards to add your own poisons to the set and 4 quick inventory cards for poison users to keep track of their poison stocks. So, as always, never stop to search through a book again - with Combat Cards the rules are at your fingertips.

[Publisher Blurb]

121062.name: Diseases
121062.description:
GM: OK, before I forget – Robert, make your disease save to prevent damage.

Player: (Rolls dice) Yes, 23 - a success.

GM: You don’t take any damage from the disease today. Out of curiosity, was the save in the last game a success or failure?

Player: I don’t remember.

GM: Because if it was a success then you’re healed.

Disease - it can be a major hazard to any adventurer and can leave even the strongest warrior a husk of his former glory. Mired in confusion and disliked by many players, often this danger is ignored by game masters. However, we at Healing Fireball Publication are here to shed light on this often-overlooked facet of fantasy gaming with our latest product Combat Cards: Diseases. In this set of cards you will find both the traditional Combat Cards style cards that explain the various rules involved in the use of diseases in your game. But this set contains so much more one card for each of the diseases listed in the SRD. As an added bonus to this set we also provide a blank disease card to add your own diseases to the set and a Disease Save record card for game masters to keep track of the diseased characters in their party's save record. So as always never stop to search through a book again - with Combat Cards the rules are at your fingertips.

[Publisher Blurb]

121063.description:

The blue dragon is a vain and territorial juggernaut of claws, scales, and beating wings, with a powerful breath weapon of crackling lightning! The third release in the D&D Icons line, this Gargantuan Blue Dragon miniature comes complete with a full-color battle map, a scenario sheet, and an oversized, double-sided stat card.

Meanwhile, as the Great Houses continue to expand their influence into Essos, Valar Dohaeris brings more of the Eastern continent's flavor. Two unique locations encourage decks that unite characters from rival houses, players continue their journey down the Rhoyne with four flowing River plots, and a host of new personalities arrive, ready to serve. Knights, Fools,
Allies, and Lords – all must show obedience and play their roles in the myriad battles and intrigues launched between rival houses as they seek to claim the Iron Throne.

The first player to reach space number 80 wins.

121067.description:

121072.name: Montezuma's Return
121072.description:
From the back of the box

Max Montezuma, daring adventurer and rumoured descendant of the legendary Aztec emperor. Our hero must discover the secrets of a lost civilisation while stranded on an uncharted tropical island. As the plot unfolds by completing a series of nine immense levels and claiming all the treasures within, the player can restore the desecrated tomb of his legendary ancestor thereby lifting the curse of the ancients. Montezuma's Return! A first-person real-time 3D action adventure game. Featuring real-time immersive 3D graphics and fast intensive gameplay, all spiced with a comic humour. Stunning graphics in 65,000 colours with standard SVGA cards. Designed to be played in a true 3D perspective - where you have to look and move in every direction. Challenging 3D puzzles.

boardgamehonor: 2012 UK Games Expo Best Card Game Winner
121073.description:
Amoebas have escaped and are slithering around in all directions! Catch them fast!

In Panic Lab, the player-scientists have their hands full trying to figure out which amoeba to catch and where it might have oozed off to. To set up the game, shuffle the 25 cards, then lay them out in a circle.

At the start of a round, one player rolls four special dice which indicate the color, shape and pattern of the amoeba being sought as well as the color of the lab it left and in which direction it was traveling. Competing at the same time, players need to find the lab, then move in the right direction to spot the amoeba (which may, of course, be striped and not spotted).

But wait! If you encounter a vent after leaving the lab, you need to skip to the next vent in the circle before continuing your search. (Amoebas prefer to travel in the dark when possible.) Plus, if an amoeba passes through one of three mutation devices in the circle, you need to alter the criteria for your search, looking for a tentacled amoeba instead of one with a tail, for example, or an orange/red amoeba instead of a blue/purple one. Zap!

The first player to lay her hand on the correct card collects a token, and the first player to collect five tokens wins!
121073.name: Panic Lab

121074.name: X-Men: Ravages of the Apocalypse

121076.description:
In Home Sweet Home, players have five diving bells and want to get as many sea creatures into them as possible – but crabs don't like octopi and vice versa, so keep those two species separate if you don't want trouble.

To set up the game, each player lays out diving bell cards in front of them, numbered 1-5, and receives four cards from the shuffled animal deck; crab and octopus cards are also numbered 1-5. At the start of a round, a player lays an animal card from her hand in the center of the table and states the sum of all cards played. The next player does the same, making sure that all animal cards are visible. This continues until the sum of the animals played totals twelve or more. The player who laid the last card takes the stack, then places the animals in her diving bells based on the number on the cards. If you would lay a crab in a diving bell that already holds one or more octopi cards (and vice versa), you must discard one card of each type.

Once the deck rounds out, players finish the round, if possible, then sum the animals in their diving bells. The player with the highest total wins!
121076.name: Home Sweet Home

videogame: Gothic II: Night of the Raven
121077.name: Gothic Universe
videogamecompilation: Gothic II: Night of the Raven
121077.description:
From the back of the box

A nameless hero becomes a legend!

Begin your journey as the nameless hero in a prison on the island of Khorinis in Gothic 1 and return tot he mainland of Myrtana in Gothic 3. Withness the destruction of the magic barrier and the fall of the dragons, investigate the numerous mysteries of Khorinis and determine the struggle between the humans and the Orcs. Your doings will affect the fate of the whole empire - for better or for worse. Your destiny and Myrtana's future are yours to forge!

121078.description:
Gamescience, pbm kit for the Renwal Gamescience 1968 game.

This module includes the rules and sheets for play by mail, for Gamescience's Battle of Britain game. A air bombing campaign game of the fight to control the air above England in WW2. The game is a forerunner to Avalon Hill's Luftwaffe.

121080.description:
Shepherds is a 2 players game (with 4 players variant) in which players try to coatch 3 (of 9) sheeps. They try to do it with one... dog. The first who do it, is a winner.

Every player has set of cards. Players alternately play a card and move the dog to try herding the sheep into their pens. Cards have values from 1 to 5, which represent exactly how many spaces the dog must move.

The used card is discarded. If a player runs out of cards, all of that player's discarded cards return to the hand. At the end of the dog's movement, the player places a pen in his color on the dog's final square.

Players take turns one after the other in this way until the game finishes.

121083.name: Lumines: Electronic Symphony
121083.description:
The king of music-puzzle games returns with its first, all-new installment in over 5 years. Lumines™ Electronic Symphony marks the return of Q Entertainment’s landmark puzzle series, bringing together addictive block-dropping puzzle action, an all-new 3D graphics engine, and some of the most significant names in electronic music history.

Key Features
Star-Studded Musical Line-Up: Featuring some of the best and brightest names in electronic music, the soundtrack for Lumines™ Electronic Symphony is a diverse selection of known artists as well as original tracks composed by Q Entertainment’s sound team, providing the ultimate aural experience.

New Block Mechanics: For the first time in the series, special new block mechanics give players additional strategic options. Clear huge block combos using the powerful Chain Block, and learn to master the randomizing powers of the Shuffle Block.

All-New EXP System: Lumines™ Electronic Symphony rewards player effort and investment by providing an in-depth player profile, deep stat tracking, and a new Experience Points system that rewards every player’s play style with a level-based reward system. The more you play –whether in solo or versus play— the richer your Lumines experience will be.
Social Experience: Compare your progress against your friends! Every time you play Lumines™ Electronic Symphony --whether in single- or multi-player modes-- you earn experience points. Another level, another rank, or another reward is always within reach. Whether you’re a new Lumines player or a veteran of the series, Lumines™ Electronic Symphony’s new social features will encourage you to play just “one more game.”

Source: The Game Website.

121084.name: Speak Up!
121084.description:
In Speak Up!, everyone plays in one of five languages – German, English, French, Spanish or Italian – and not knowing the language won't necessarily be a detriment.

To set up the game, lay out 49 of the fifty cards on the table with the picture side faceup; next to the picture is the name of the item in five languages. The back of each card features the name of some other item in five languages.

To start play, take the card set aside during set-up and read one of the words on the back, say "Markt" (the German word for "market"). Everyone then races to find the card depicting the market, which will also have the various words for "market" next to the picture. Whoever finds it keeps the card, then flips it over and reads the German word on the back. This process continues until all the cards have been claimed. Whoever has the most cards wins!

121085.description:
The Kickstarter Technology Card is an exclusive promo card for Legacy: Gears of Time given to people who backed the project on Kickstarter. This technology card is added to the deck and can be played like any other technology, provided the prerequisites to do so are met:

These Technologies build off the core set of technologies, but introduce a shift in balance to the existing technology tree Satellites and Antibiotics make the communication and medical branches even stronger contenders over the transportation branch, more choices and more challenges! Banking has a dependency on Law, giving you a fantastic reason to go out of your way to keep influencing the previously terminal technology. Universities depends on the new Fundamental Technology Art and has 0 discard cost. Be sure to have some Influence Cubes ready, the reward is worth the effort!

121087.name: La Llamada de Cthulhu (Edición primigenia)
121087.description:
publisher blurb

La llamada de Cthulhu es un juego de rol basado en la obra de H. P. Lovecraft, en el que personas corrientes se enfrentan a las espantosas fuerzas de los Mitos de Cthulhu. Los primigenios gobernaron la Tierra eones antes de la aparición del hombre, pero aún hoy es posible encontrar restos de sus ciclópeas ciudades en remotas islas del Pacífico, bajo la arena de los vastos desiertos y en las gélidas desolaciones de los casquetes polares. En un principio vinieron a este mundo desde las estrellas, pero ahora duermen; unos, en las profundidades de la tierra, y otros, bajo el mar. Sin embargo, cuando las estrellas estén en posición, se alzarán y caminarán de nuevo sobre la Tierra.

user summary

121088.name: Dice Dodge
121088.description:
Dice Dodge is a dice game related to those in the jeopardy family, which includes Pig and Farkle. However, instead of the choices being "keep rolling" or "stop", one must choose whether to roll along a column, row, or across the entire board in order to maximize their chances of winning.

Gameplay involves tossing two dice and marking the space on the board corresponding to the row and column rolled. The player then decides whether to roll one or both dice again in order to place more markers on the board. The point value of a row or column is equal to the number of markers on it, squared. If a player rolls a space that has already been marked, their turn ends and their score is tallied. The winner of the game is the player with the most points after a set number of rounds.

121089.name: Mutant Fortress
121089.description:
User Summary

Mutant Fortress is a budget run-and-gun game. The back of the box says:

MUTIES STOLE MY TRUCK

Evil muties have hijacked your beloved armour-plated eighteen-wheeler and have hidden it somewhere inside their massive fortified base. You must battle your way through the zombie infested forest, before you can reach your final objective.

121090.name: Claim to Fame Travel Edition
121090.description:
To win Claim to Fame, you need to be the first team to move from start to finish by getting your team members to yell out five facts about celebrities and other famous people. Each round you have sixty seconds to deliver verbal hints, act out charades, draw clues – or all three – to aide teammates in guessing the facts listed on the back of your celebrity card.

Claim to Fame Travel Edition includes celebrity cards that can be used in the base game, while also being playable as a game on their own without the other components.

121091.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Killer Bunnies return to pillage and burn with the addition of Specialty Bunny cards such as the Priscillan trio that allows players to play extra cards during their turn! Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Violet Booster Deck adds 55 new cards to the existing Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot set, as well as a clear 20-sided die.

New cards include: "Reno 911" which causes a police raid on your opponent's cards, "Campaign Contributions" for "influencing" (wink, wink) the votes of Senators, "Betty Botter" for increasing your Radish and Milk supplies and the "Grand Slam" which, combined with lucky die rolls, awards a player with three Carrots! The new Defense Cards can eliminate threatening weapons such as "Blipverts" or the ever-vengeful "Heathers"!
121091.name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Violet Booster Deck

121092.name: Expression
121092.description:
Instead of forming the words with letters players forms sentences with the words randomly drawn from the bag.
There are also some joker-cards what can be used to be an any word.

Time is chosen by the participants and everybody starts to forming the sentences.

If time is over the scoring begins.
Each word (including the joker) earns you two points.
For each word taken from the bonus column: 1
If the player winning the bid is the current player: 3
If you have not used the joker: 6
If you used the 12 cards: 6

At the end of the game, whoever has the highest number of points wins.

121093.name: Master & Commander: Close Quarters
121093.description:
From Their Website:
Master & Commander: Close Quarters is a set of rules designed for playing boarding actions between Napoleonic ships. Now you can play in detail such famous actions as ‘Nelson’s Patent Bridge for Boarding First-Rates’ in the battle of Saint Vincent, follow Captain Decatur in a boarding action against Barbary Corsairs, or board the Royal Navy ships with the San Juan Neponucemo at Trafalgar

Fast, innovative and simple playing system. Designed to play with our ship boards, and CAPITAN MINIATURES 18mm crews,all you need to play is downloable for free.

121095.name: Board Games: All in One
121095.description:
User Summary

Board Games – All in one is a compilation of classic board games such as Checkers, Chinese checkers, Chess, Backgammon, Ludo, Nine Men's Morris, Reversi, Fox and Geese, Tic Tac Toe and Peg Solitaire.

This game only presents the board and the pieces, it doesn’t enforce the rules.

121096.name: Detectives' Chase
121096.description:
"Detectives' Chase is a board game in which a team of players, as "police", cooperate to track down a player controlling a "criminal" around a board representing the streets of London. One player controls "Mr. X", a criminal whose location is only revealed periodically, and the other players each control a detective, which is always present on the board.

All players start with a number of tickets allowing them a certain number of moves using the following methods:

Taxis allow the player to move only one space for each ticket used. They can be used to reach any point in London, most of which are not accessible in this game by other means.

Buses are available throughout most of the map, allowing longer-distance travel more quickly if the player is located at a bus-stop.

The subway in this game also allows quick travel between distant points of London. However, stations are far apart so the use of a subway ticket can narrow down the possibilities of Mr. X's location.

Water routes are available, which only Mr. X can use."

Source: The Developer Website.

121097.name: Doodlestein 3D
121097.description:
User Summary

Doodlestein 3D is a first person shooter game, it has great cartoonish graphics but the action is real, you need to kill all enemies in your path to survive.

121098.name: The Mighty Hood II
121098.description:
The Mighty Hood II is a two-player game that simulates the main World War II battles involving HMS Hood, pride of the Royal Navy. Players maneuver their ships on the tabletop (or floor) and try and defeat the enemy through combat. The standard game covers the Battle of Denmark Strait in May, 1941, pitting Hood and Prince of Wales against the German Bismarck and Prinz Eugen. Another scenario covers the Battle of Mers-el-Kebir in July 1940, when British forces led by Hood neutralized the Vichy French fleet along the coast of North Africa.

The game is a heavily-revised version of The Mighty Hood, which appeared in Panzerschreck magazine #14. The new game provides new ship ratings, introduces new rules and modifications congruent with the Battleship Captain standard game system, and adds ships allowing gamers to recreate the Mers-el-Kebir scenario.

Battleship Captain is a "miniatures" game system with scenarios played on the tabletop or floor, using the rules and ship counters provided. Scale is 1"=1000 yards. The game emphasizes playability, as players maneuver their ships and try and defeat the enemy fleet.

The game also requires a tape measure or ruler in inches, paper and pencil, and a six-sided die.

121101.name: Alpine Games
121101.description:
User Summary

A winter sports game with 5 events: skiing, ski jump, speed skating, bob-sled and biathlon. The player's score in each of the five events determine whether or not they are awarded medals.

121102.name: American Football
121102.description:
User Summary

A Top-down view American football simulation by Amsoft. The game can be played against the computer or another opponent.

121103.description:
Hunt for the Fugitive is a BGG Store Promo card that expands Dragon Valley: Rise for Corundia.

Its effect is:

"Choose One:

Move one Friendly or Enemy Unit in your Barony one or two spaces.
Place a purple cube in a built Dungeon in your Barony
Remove all purple cubes in a built Dungeon in your Barony. Score 1, 3, 6, 10 for removing 1,2,3,4 cubes respectively."




It can be added to the King's Aid deck during game setup. It is divided and chosen in the same fashion as other King's Aid cards.
boardgameversion: Diamond K Games BGG Promo Edition
121103.name: Dragon Valley: Hunt for the Fugitive

121104.name: P.B.G.: President, Balayeur, General
121104.description: The goal in this card game is to climb up the career ladder to make as much money as possible. Each player is randomly assigned a profession at the start of the game; then a trick taking game is played in which each player holds six hidden cards plus some (depending on the number of players) cards which are drawn openly. The rank of the profession determines how players may talk to each others, mistakes are punished by penalty cards. After finishing a round, a player is demoted if s/he has more cards of the profession below him/her plus penalty cards. Promotions are then resolved as a result of demotions, and everybody gets their salary. The first player to own 100000 Euros is the winner.

121105.description:
These mini-games can be used as filler games or during a game of Dragon Valley: Rise of Corundia of 3 or 4 players while two players are waiting for the division of King's Aid. Purple cubes and/or Unit cubes from the Unit bag are used to keep track of game play aspects in Dragon Valley Tourneys.

Players start with Jousting. If finished before the other player(s) have completed the dividing in Dragon Valley: Rise of Corundia, they move on to Archery. If there is still time, they move to the Trebuchet Tourney and afterwards back again to Jousting. If the dividing is complete, finish any score checks but do not continue. If a scoring criteria was not met, no player gains score in Dragon Valley: Rise of Corundia from the current tourney. They do keep the score earned in previous tourneys during this division. Make sure to return any purple cubes to the board and units back into the cloth bag. The next division starts with the next mini-game.

If players are not comfortable playing traditional Rock Parchment Swords, an alternate is to pull Blue, Red and Yellow cubes from the bag and secretly selecting one (if enough are there, otherwise use cubes from the board, but remember where they came from.)
121105.name: Dragon Valley Tourneys

121106.name: Master & Commander: Frigates
121106.description:
“Frigates!" cried Nelson,"Were I to die this moment, want of frigates, would be found engraved on my heart" (Nelson said these words when he was chasing round the Mediterranean in search of the French expedition to Egypt)

Attached to a fleet, the frigates were the eyes and ears, ranging in line abreast over a immense expanse of sea while battleships kept steadily on line ahead, repeating signals and carrying dispatches.

Detached either singly or in small squadrons the frigates might be sent anywhere in the world to attack enemy commerce and protect their own, to hunt down privateers or pirates, or to take part in the conquest of yet another colony.

In the British Admiralty the Frigates were rated 5th rate, and small frigates 6th rate, the other small vessels used to support the operations of the frigates were classified as unrated, and they include a variety of ships from the larger corvettes and sloops of war to the small cutters and schooners. We include too, some 4th rates two deckers vessels, that, in some cases were used to execute and support frigate duties despite they were slow and cumbersome an many of them out-dated.

All this operations and engagements are covered by our rules Master & Commander Frigates. We have included 48 British, 48 Spanish, 48 French, 48 US, 40 Dutch & 24 Danish ships, including Two deckers, Frigates, Rasées, Sloops of War, Brigs of War, Schooners, & Cutters. The years covered with the ships are from the American War of Independence, French Revolutionary Wars, Napoleonic Wars, & 1812 War.

To play Frigates you need the Master & Commander Rules, Turning Templates, and Sailing Tables from Capitan Games. Along with these you will need the optional rule for Beating. All of these can be downloaded in pdf format (A4 paper size) from the Capitan Games website.

121107.name: Introduction to the Star Fleet Universe: Prime Directive and Roleplaying
121107.description:
Ever wondered just what is the Star Fleet Universe? Want to find out?

This short introduction provides some of the background, "geography," timeline, mysteries, and a quick look at the species inhabiting the Star Fleet Universe. It can also be used as a brief introduction of what is "known" for new players at demos and conventions. Come game with us in the Star Fleet Universe!

From publisher's website: www.starfleetgames.com

121108.name: Stoked! Skateboarding Must Die
121108.description: Collectible card game set in a future where skateboarding is illegal. The first two runs of the cards are called Vegalas and Socalia. The cards feature real art from Birdhouse skateboards and cartoon versions of two Birdhouse skateboarders. Each player creates a deck as in most collectable card games. You will play places to skate, money, equipment and people who will help you. There are also skateboard tricks that can be linked in sequence to earn "stoke" points. Earn 360 points and you win, if you drop to zero game over.

121109.name: Viriax
121109.description:
Retro visuals and music, simple controls and procedural generated levels can turn this little game into something adictive, plus when it comes to challenge yourself with a score system that consists in the sum of your best score in each level.

Be part of the Viriax infection and show humans who set the rules in the Earth. Infect important organs one by one, and destroy the ultimate defensive hope of humanity, the Nanobot Assembly System, implemented as a chip near the brain.

Reach the organ core to infect it, but watch your energy level: each time you move up or attack you will lose part of your energy, as also you will lose a bunch of energy if you get hit by an enemy cell. Collect red globules to keep your energy full and think when it's a good moment to stop and make some points.

Source: Developer Website.

121110.name: F.E.A.R. Files
121110.description:
F.E.A.R. Files is a complete stand alone expansion pack that combines the award winning F.E.A.R. Extraction Point and F.E.A.R. Perseus Mandate (the latest edition to the F.E.A.R. franchise) together in one box!

In F.E.A.R. Extraction Point, the Replicas are no longer your only nemeses, as powerful supernatural entities are wreaking havoc on everything and anything that crosses their path. With F.E.A.R. Perseus Mandate, you are a member of a secondary F.E.A.R. team, brought in to uncover information regarding the secret project at Armacham.

- Includes the Perseus Mandate campaign as well as the award-winning expansion pack Extraction Point.
- Dynamic Combat Missions alter the flow of battle and remove all predictability.
- New multipayer and instant action maps, and new F.E.A.R. missions never before available on console.
- Engage in unpredictable encounters with combat adaptable A.I.
- Battle new and even more terrifying enemies with 6 new weapons.
- Enhanced destructible environments.
- Multiplayer support for up to 16 players.

Source: The Developer Website.

121111.name: New Super Mario Bros. U
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Platformer Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
videogamecompilation: New Super Mario Bros. U + New Super Luigi U
121111.description:
New Super Mario Bros. U is an all new adventure that brings Mario™ and his friends into your living room like never before! The Wii U GamePad controller gives you and your family a whole new window into the Mushroom Kingdom, with fantastic new features that are only possible on the Wii U console.

The Wii U GamePad, included with every Wii U console, brings people together like you've never imagined. Here are just some of the new ways that you'll enjoy playing with Mario and friends.

- Now up to five players* can play together, with four Wii Remote controllers and Boost Mode on the Wii U GamePad.
- A player can pick up the GamePad any time and help out by placing Boost Blocks and distracting enemies via the Touch Screen.
- Super easy drop-in play lets you add a player to play with a Wii Remote™ controller any time—even in the middle of a level.
- Switch gameplay to the GamePad only in single-player mode, and free up your TV screen for the family to use.

Source: The Game Website.

121113.name: Di-Gata Defenders
121113.description:
From the back of the box:

Join the Di-Gata Defenders in their battle against the evil Lord Nazmul and his Order of Inifnis! Create and customize you skills throught the game by building strategies and unlocking powerful stones and abilities. Explore 3 provinces of the Rados World as you collect and trade items to help you advance in the game. Get ready to CAST THE POWER!

121114.name: 100 All-Time Favorites
121114.description:
From back of the box:

Take a break with the ULTIMATE collection of classic games!

videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogameversion: English/European Wii U (Join or Die) edition
121115.description:
ASSASSIN’S CREED III INVITES PLAYERS TO EXPERIENCE THE UNTOLD STORY OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION THROUGH THE EYES OF A NEW ASSASSIN, CONNOR.

Designed from the ground up over more than two years, Assassin’s Creed III takes one of gaming’s most beloved franchises to new heights.

The year is 1775. The American colonies are about to revolt. You are Connor, an assassin who has sworn to secure liberty for his people and his nation. To do so, you will hunt your enemies across a staggeringly large, open, and realistic world. You will unleash your lethal skills in a violent quest that will take you from chaotic city streets to blood-soaked battlefields in the hostile American wilderness and beyond. You will meet legendary heroes of American history, and together you will conspire to annihilate those who threaten Liberty itself.

Whether you use your predatory instincts to kill silently, or your fearsome arsenal to kill openly, one thing is clear: the world that the Assassins live in has become far more deadly. And so have you.

Source: The Game Website.

videogameexpansion: Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Betrayal
Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Infamy
Assassin's Creed III: The Tyranny of King Washington – The Redemption

121116.name: Pikmin 3
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee

121117.name: Metro: Last Light
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Most Beautiful Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
121117.description:
Metro: Last Light (formerly Metro 2034) is a single-player first-person shooter and horror video game developed by Ukrainian studio 4A Games and published by Deep Silver for Microsoft Windows, Linux, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. It was released in May 2013. The game is set in a post-apocalyptic world and features a mixture of action-oriented and stealth gameplay.

The game exists in the universe of the novel Metro 2033 and its sequels, written by Russian author, Dmitry Glukhovsky, but does not follow any direct storylines from the books. Previously announced as Metro 2034, the game is a sequel to the video game Metro 2033, and although Glukhovsky has apparently been working with the developers, it bears no relation to the book Metro 2034. Rumours on his website point to the upcoming book, Metro 2035, to be a novelisation of Metro: Last Light. Initially, the game was to be published under THQ and expected to be released in the middle of 2012; it was announced on February 2, 2012, that the game would be delayed until the first quarter of 2013, and on March 1, 2013 the game was delayed again until May. Following THQ's closure in January 2013, the intellectual property was acquired by video game publisher Deep Silver. A PlayStation 4 version of the game has been announced, although no release date was given

Source: Wikipedia, "Metro: Last Light", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121118.name: LEGO City: Undercover
videogameversion: North American Nintendo Selects Wii U edition
121118.description:
Lego City Undercover is a comedic sandbox-style action-adventure video game developed by TT Fusion, a division of TT Games, for the Wii U. The game was released on 18 March 2013 in North America, Europe and Australia on 28 March 2013 and in Japan on 25 July 2013. A prequel was also developed for the Nintendo 3DS. Unlike previous Lego titles developed by TT Games, which have been based on various licenses, the game is based on the Lego City brand and is the first Lego game to be published by Nintendo.

Gameplay

Taking place in the vast Lego City, players control an undercover cop named Chase McCain. Chase goes on the hunt for criminals, with various moves at his disposal, such as swinging across poles and performing wall jumps; he can also gain disguises that give him additional abilities, such as a robber disguise that lets him break locks. Chase can also pilot vehicles, such as cars and helicopters, and use loose bricks to build various objects. The Wii U GamePad can be used as a device including a communicator and as a scanner to locate criminals.

Lego City Undercover's gameplay borrows heavily from the Grand Theft Auto series. However the game is role-reversed with the player taking on the role of a police officer enforcing the law, rather than a criminal committing crime, although the player is required to commit criminal acts on some occasions in order to infiltrate criminal gangs. The game also includes references to notable Nintendo intellectual properties, such as offering the ability to build a Lego Super Mario universe warp pipe.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lego City Stories", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121119.name: Rabbids Land
121119.description:
Rabbids take over our beloved amusement park!

Rabbids decide to take over our beloved amusement park and they plan to make the most of their day out by invading all the attractions!

They don’t intend to queue like everyone else or stay seated during the whole journey!

As Rabbids will always be Rabbids, you’ll see them misusing the rides, going bwaaah at a souvenir shop before stopping in an overpriced themed restaurant.

So whether it’s a sunny or rainy day, just grab your WiiU tablet and roll the dice to join them!
