121414.description:
In the modular game Countdown: Special Ops, you are in charge of a special ops team with a special mission! Find hidden bombs and dismantle them, help hostages into safety, or take out terrorist leaders. Due to the high variation in goals, targets, threats and specific circumstances, players need to choose their set-up and strategy each time they start a mission or a campaign. Don't just throw in grenades with your buster at public places such as airports and train stations, or else civilians might get hurt, resulting in negative points on your mission balance. (Plus, you know, injuring civilians is not cool.) Develop your primary skill, but don't neglect your attack power, defense power and other skills if you want to stay alive in this thrilling new game.

Countdown: Special Ops is fully modular, with players being able to create their own game by adjusting four different aspects of play:


Game situations: With more than 200 playing cards, the challenges and threats are different each time you play.
Game mode: You can play a single mission, a campaign or a scenario; each game mode has its own level and duration, and you're advised to start with a single mission on the lowest level (green).
Level up: Did you succeed a few times on level green? If so, you might want to try the next (orange) level or even a scenario, that is, three missions in a row with increasing difficulty!
Goals: Even players' goals can be altered. Countdown: Special Ops is a co-operative game, but if you'd like to change the rules, you could add one or two traitors to the team and play "Traitor Mode".


Development
You can develop your own Special Op by improving his or her skills. This is done in scenario or campaign play. This brings out interesting aspects of the game in which you have to choose how many risk you want to take to gain extra experience or if you want to move slow and stay alive at all cost...

This variation, combined with the 30-minute time limit per mission, makes the experience of a mission "feel" like an actual PC game in many aspects. Smart development is essential to survive the missions on higher threat levels.
121414.name: Countdown: Special Ops
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 14.4 - Essen Spiel 2013 Special

121415.name: Big Kahuna Reef
121415.description:
Go Hawaiian in this gorgeous underwater adventure! Discover Sea Turtles and other aquatic life as you break open boxes in this classic style matching game, questing for the Mask of the Tiki. Using the revolutionary Mouse Party, you can play with multiple players on the same computer through an almost infinite number of levels, thanks to the included level editor. As you play, you will uncover greater challenges including the Skeleton Fish of Kamehameha. Lead on Kahuna...your quest awaits!

Source: The Game Website.

121416.name: Big Kahuna Reef 2: Chain Reaction
121416.description:
Go Hawaiian all over again! This spectacular and explosively charged match-game of adventure will captivate you as you dive with Humpback Whales, discovering new and exotic fish at every turn. Creative designers from around the world deliver over 750 of the most delightful and fantastical levels ever to be found in the deep blue sea. With its breathtaking effects, dynamic explosions and thousands of new levels to download online, what are you waiting for? Come back to an underwater paradise!

Source: The Game Website.

121417.name: Big Kahuna Party
121417.description:
Embark on a tropical adventure with this explosively charged puzzle game. Big Kahuna Party is a match-3 game with several new innovations designed to provide a frenzied and fun multiplayer experience for up to 4 players. Alternatively, if you're looking to relax, you can play single player and enjoy level after level set in beautiful Tiki themed environments.

With intuitive Wii specific controls, players can swap tiles faster and more fluidly than ever before using either just the Wii Remote, or with both the Wii Remote and the Nunchuk. That speed will come in handy in the multiplayer modes, where the underwater matching madness can get intense.

Big Kahuna Party also features Bombs! Created as players make matches of 5 or more, explosives come in various sizes from little sticks of dynamite to huge nuclear bombs. These are especially useful in multiplayer competitive matches where players race to own the most territory by clearing squares before their competitors.

With nearly a hundred levels sure to keep players entertained for hours and friendly casual game play that ensures everyone in the family can join in on the fun, Big Kahuna Party is an unbeatable way to take the family on a tropical holiday from the comfort of your own living room.

Source: The Game Website.

121418.name: Big Kahuna Bundle
121418.description:
User Summary

Includes Big Kahuna Reef and Big Kahuna Words. Both games are puzzle games in which you must break boxes and free sea life by either matching objects (BK Reef) or making word combinations (BK Words)

121419.name: Hell's Highway
121419.description:
The year is 2074, twenty six years after a world-wide radiation accident scorched the Earth. Weaponized cars roam the Wastelands in search of gasoline, fortune and food. The slave trade is booming, corrupt officials and outlaw gangs reign free and a dwindling Highway Patrol struggles to uphold what little peace is left in the world. Brave (or stupid) Highwaymen try their luck in The League, a vicious death race in the corrupt city of Broken Hill.

All is not lost however. There is a Resistance forming. A lose network of renegades, gadgeteers and freedom fighters is starting to surface. Safe houses and outposts are slowly popping up and there are even rumors of usable soil out there.

Will you join an outlaw gang of marauders in search of potential slaves? Will you trick-out your car and win your fortune racing in The League? Will you seek justice and avenge the murder of your partner from the Highway Patrol? Or are you just trying to locate a pilot light to fix the passenger-side flame-thrower on the Plymouth Firebomber you stole last week?

121420.name: Operation: Eradicate
121420.description:
From the ashes of the last global war, a new threat rises that threatens all people. Calling them the 'Infected One' or just plain Zombies matters little if they kill us all.

Operation: Eradicate is a unique cooperative turn-based strategy game that pits your wits against the zombie hordes across the planet.

Control any of five different commanders, all with unique abilities, to rid the world of the plague slowly dying monsters. It is your against the masses. Race to decimate the hordes before they overwhelm the planet. Play matches with two to four commanders on three different difficulty levels (including the No Hope! Challenge).

Features

Board Game feel, iPad looks
Cooperative Turn Based Strategy mechanics
Game Center Turn Based Multiplayer available
Five specialized characters to command
Play a 2, 3 or 4 character game for vastly different challenges
Includes hand drawn commissioned artwork
Three different Difficulty levels
Game Center Leader boards & Achievements
Multi-step tutorial to quickly learn the game




Source: The Game Website.

121421.name: Robo5
121421.description:
Robo5 is a 3D-Action-Puzzle game.

Players will be able to play the game by using "click/slide": two types of gesture to complete the game

Robo5 consists of 5 Chapters and 40 levels, and another 8 hidden diaries that can be found during the game.

Robo5 is easy to understand and simple to control at the early stages of the game. Later on, it is full of challenges.

Source: The Game Website. Edited for clarity.

121422.name: Tires of Fury
121422.description:
Get ready for some serious monster truck racing action, using your driving skills and weapons to take the checkered flag!

Play against your friends in multiplayer, or take on computer opponents in a frantic race to the finish line!

Welcome to Tires of Fury Island! Here, you’ll race across a wide variety of environments against a rag-tag group of unique racing machines and drivers.

Unsatisfied with current racing games, two brothers, Jared, age 7, and Evan, age 6, put their pencils to paper to sketch out a unique new racing game. Our artists and programmers went to work to make these young game-designers’ vision a reality, and here is the exciting result!

Head to the garage and pick your ride from a line-up of monster trucks like you’ve never seen, including pirate ships, laser tanks, space ships, and more! Each one has a unique balance of attributes that you can upgrade according to your preferences using your race winnings. Also, three unique drivers each offer an additional boost to your stats.

Use power-ups like rockets, oil slicks and nitros to give you the edge you need to win! But be careful, everyone else will be using them as well! Blast, slick and boost your way to the win! Even the environments are against you as you dodge truck-crushing boulders and giant snowballs that can instantly change the outcome of a race.

Features
➢ 6 unique rides let you race in style!
➢ Play simultaneously with up to 7 friends online!
➢ Play the iPhone version Head-to-Head over Bluetooth - no Internet connection needed!
➢ Race in snowy mountains, spooky swamps, city streets and everything in between!
➢ Destroy your opponents with a weapons arsenal including homing missiles and oil slicks!
➢ Customize your truck with top speed, acceleration and handling boosts!

Source: The Game Website.

121423.description:
City building has never been so easy: Just roll the dice, then build a building. However, each die must be selected carefully to fit the building requirements. Push your luck too far – or select carelessly – and a player may find himself demolishing his city instead of building it up. Choose each die wisely and build efficiently in order to erect magnificent skyscrapers and create the best skyline!

Skyline is a quick push-your-luck dice game involving set collection. Unlike other dice games that provide no relationship from turn to turn and no player interaction, this game allows players to literally build upon their decisions each turn and react to their opponents' actions.

Each turn, players choose to roll dice from either the Construction Yard or the Abandoned District, with the goal of erecting urban buildings. Buildings are made up of three types of dice: Ground Floor dice, Mid-Floor dice and Penthouse dice. Some buildings are safer to build but provide little reward, while other buildings have poor probabilities but can have substantial impact on the success of a player's skyline.

After rolling their selected dice, the player must use at least one of these dice to take one of three possible actions: Abandon, Build, or Cancel Construction. The Build action is the desired outcome, of course, but can be carried out only if the die result matches what they need to build. For instance, all Ground Floor dice can be built without restriction, but a High-Rise Mid-Floor die result can be built only on top of a High-Rise Ground Floor die. Likewise, a Mid-Rise Penthouse die can be built only on a Mid-Rise Mid-Floor die. If the rolled results do not allow them to Build, then the player must Cancel Construction on one of their existing buildings. If a player does not want to Cancel Construction, then they must Abandon by placing that die in the Abandoned District, which gives their opponents the opportunity to capitalize on this failure.

At the end of the game, points are rewarded for completed buildings according to their height. A Level 3 building – that is, a building comprised of three dice – is worth 9 points, while a Level 4 building is worth 16, and so on.

Remember, the dice control the results...but the players control the dice.
121423.name: Skyline

121424.name: Auf geht's mit der Rheinischen Post
121424.description:
A promotional Game by a regional newspaper for cultural attractions in the Rheinland region in the West of Germany.

Players roll a die and move a pawn along a track through the region "discovering it" by drawing and reading cards when they land on certain spaces.

121425.description:
The Steel Police is a wandering brigade of law and order fanatics, clad in pre-war, experimental power armor. Chemicals applied by the armor and cybernetic enhancements increase the organism’s abilities at the expense of the psyche – Steel Police officers will automatically respond to anything the program identifies as threat or crime. They appear out of nowhere and pacify the area amid the roar of explosions and gunfire.

Unblemished lawfulness worthy of the automatic machine quickly makes the people of redeemed lands yearn for the old chaos and anarchy.

The Steel Police – one of the symbols of Neuroshima world – now enters the universe of Neuroshima Hex...

Neuroshima Hex! Steel Police is the first army pack, part of a series of mini game expansions containing one Neuroshima Hex army. The army's author in none other than the game's author – Michał Oracz. The Steel Police army pack introduces a new ability in a Neuroshima Hex line. It is called Reflection. Reflection protects the army unit from all attacks directed at its side marked with Reflection icon. Such attack is reflected in the opposite direction for a distance of one field and hits an enemy tile (Unit, HQ or Module) if it stands on an adjacent field on the line of attack. Reflected attack doesn't harm Steel Police tiles.
121425.name: Neuroshima Hex! Steel Police
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

121427.description:
User summary
A fantasy golf themed card game. Players choose different characters and a stage consisting of a series of cards is created. All players start at the first card, and try to pass them in order by playing cards from their hand, by exceeding the stage card level with the card they play. All cards have a specific effect and can be played to hinder other players from advancing.

The player with the most points after 3 stages wins.
121427.name: Passion!

121428.name: Kaiju Fight
121428.description:
Published in Game Market 2004.

The game is composed of 2 rounds.
In the first round, players bids to get his monster, its 4 attacks, its 3 defenses, its 2 special abilities and its 1 weakness. Now, each player has his monster with 4 attacks and 3 defenses and 2 special abilities and 1 weakness.
In the second round, each player attack one of other monster in agility order.
The game ends when only one monster survive the second round.

121429.description:
Ascari is a company-level game based on the stories of loyal solders who fought for Italy in Eritrea, the first Italian colony. The game depicts four battles in which the Italians were the protagonists: the two battles of Agordat against the Dervishes, Amba Alagi, and Coatit against the Ethiopians. A bonus scenario depicting the battle of Metemma between the Dervishes and the Ethiopian Emperor Johannes IV is also included.

Here are the description of the Scenarios:
S1 First Agordat:
A raiding party of Dervishes are caught by the Ascari troops commanded by Captain Gustavo Fara in the plain of Agordat.

S2 Agordat:
2200 native Askari and some Italian national soldiers, led by Lt. Colonel Arimondi, encounters in the plain of Agordat around 12,000 Mahdists, led by the Amir of Ghedaref, attempting to invade the Italian Colony of Eritrea. An astonishing Italian victory and the very first one of the young nation.

S3 Coatit:
The Italian Army in Eritrea, led by General Baratieri, wins its last victory before Adowa, attacking the overhelming Ras Mangasha’s Army at Coatit, fighting two days and performing a perfect redeployment under enemy fire. Tactically a draw, but stra-tegically a victory.

S4 Amba Alagi
The political quarrel between Gen. Arimondi and Eritrea Governor Baratieri led the IV Native Bat-talion to be put in the advanced position of Amba Alagi, just in front of the full Negus Menelik Ethiopian Army. Arimondi wanted to repeat Agordat, when with few troops managed to win the day, and therefore, despite Baratieri’s order to withdraw the Battalion, he didn’t forward it to Lt. Toselli, condemning hime and his men to sure death… it will be the prelude to Adowa!

S5 Metemma
After the sack of the historic capital city of Gondar in 1888, Negus Neghesti Johannes IV gathered an army to repel the Mahdists from the city of Metemma. While on the way to victory, the Ethiopians melt away demoralized by the killing of their Emperor during the final assault.
121429.name: Ascari

121430.name: Hot Wheels:  Road Race Game
121430.description:
It is a race to get to the race! Be the first player to complete all four auto maintenance tasks and get to the racetrack finish line to win.

2-4 players move around the outer portion of the game then to the inner track. If a player makes it to the center track without completing all tasks that player must continue to do laps around the inner track until the car mainenance is finished.

The first player to make it to the racetrack finish line and have completed all four maintenance jobs wins the game.

Contents:
1 Game board
4 pawns
1 die
24 game tiles (6 oil change, 6 paint job, 6 new set of tires, 6 tank of gas)

121431.name: LSD: Dream Emulator
121431.description:
User Summary

Based on the dream diaries of one of the developers, LSD is a slow-paced exploration game with no combat and very little interaction. The game consists of vignettes taking place in semi-randomized, surreal spaces interspersed with abstract cutscenes and occasional multiple-choice questions.

The game originally came packaged with a book of excerpts from the dream diary and a soundtrack CD.

121432.name: Caleórn y la Maldición del Lobisome
121432.description:
We are in northern Spain in the late ninth century. The mercenary camp led by Basurde has been cursed; his men are butchered by a dreadful beast. Thus, Basurde, his adopted son Gilem, and Sabba a mysterious and strange monster-buster woman decide to investigate these events and put an end to the killing.

They discover a Basurde’s old sorceress enemy behind all this. She’s well protected inside her cave, built with powerful magical defenses which can only be broken by placing three stellar rocks at its entrance.

Each player’s goal is finding a stellar rock and face together the sorceress in her own cave, the Den of Wolves. A series of tests and challenges will be required before the rocks are reachable. Meanwhile, the player who controls the sorceress will also control all the enemies and events happening to the adventurers in the game.

121433.name: Racing Gears Advance
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121433.description:
Racing Gears Advance is a combat racing game for the Game Boy Advance system released in 2004 and includes licensed vehicles from GM, Dodge, Mitsubishi and Lotus Cars. It was the breakout game for Orbital Media Inc. and received high ratings from the likes of GameSpot and IGN, staying in the top 5 GBA games for 2005.
The soundtrack is notable for having been composed by Neil D. Voss, known for his prior work on Tetrisphere and The New Tetris.
This game may be conceived as a mix between Gran Turismo (for the sim racing part) and Impact Racing (because it uses weapons in the game). All circuit cups (there are five total) take the name of letters from the Greek alphabet (Alpha, Gamma, Delta, Epsilon, Omega), with each cup having five tracks (so 25 tracks total).
Characters such as Spacewave, Jack Speed, Throttle, etc., drive the following cars:
Cadillac Escalade
Chevrolet Corvette
Chevrolet SSR
Dodge Viper
Dodge Magnum
Hummer H2
Lotus Esprit
Lotus Exige
Lotus Elise
Lotus 340R
Mitsubishi Lancer

Source: Wikipedia, "Racing Gears Advance", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121434.name: Klonoa: Empire of Dreams
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121434.description:
Klonoa: Empire of Dreams (Japanese: 風のクロノア 夢見る帝国, Kaze no Kuronoa Yumemiru Teikoku lit. Klonoa of the Wind: Dreaming Empire) is a video game published by Namco for the Game Boy Advance and released in Japan and North America in 2001 and Europe the following year. Falling somewhere between Klonoa: Door to Phantomile and Klonoa 2: Lunatea's Veil, Empire of Dreams is a two-dimensional adventure game with puzzle elements that takes place in the new realm in the Klonoa series, the Kingdom of Jillius.

Taking place after Klonoa 2: Lunatea's Veil, Klonoa: Empire of Dreams follows the adventures of Klonoa after he awakens one morning in the Kingdom of Jillius, and is dragged by the emperor's royal guards to his throne room for seemingly no reason. Emperor Jillius himself informs Klonoa that he broke the sacred law of his kingdom by dreaming, which he views as a worthless endeavor and a total waste of time. The Emperor himself suffers from insomnia, and decrees that if he cannot be allow to dream, then no one can. Rather than punish Klonoa outright, he instead offers him a challenge: defeat the four great monsters that are wreaking havoc on the land, and he will be set free. Joined by his friend Huepow, Klonoa has no choice but to travel to the surrounding lands and do battle with the monsters living there, hoping to earn his freedom and bring peace to the kingdom at last.

Klonoa: Empire of Dreams works like a typical 2D sidescroller with the player moving Klonoa left or right on a scrolling screen while defeating enemies using his "wind bullet", a special ring that can shoot a small gust of wind forward and draw an enemy in, allowing Klonoa to lift them over his head. From this position, he can either throw them straight forward like a projectile, taking out any enemy they hit, or he can perform a double-jump, allowing him to reach places he couldn't normally. In addition to enemies, Klonoa can also pick up large square blocks and place them wherever the player chooses. By holding the jump button after Klonoa has left the ground, Klonoa flaps his ears can float in mid-air for a short duration, which also somewhat increases his jumping height.
The game is progressed by finding the exit to a stage after collecting three stars within the level. Other items like crystals and hearts can be collected in addition, and 1-up items (resembling Klonoa's hat) are usually hidden within a level as well. Hearts can also be found to increase Klonoa's health.

Source: Wikipedia, "Klonoa: Empire of Dreams", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121435.name: Klonoa 2 Dream Champ Tournament
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
121435.description:
Klonoa 2: Dream Champ Tournament (Japanese: Kaze no Klonoa G2: Dream Champ Tournament) is a video game published by Namco and released on the Game Boy Advance in Japan in 2002 and North America in early 2005. As the third game in the Klonoa handheld series, the game retains many of the gameplay elements of the previous titles, while adding in a few of its own.

Klonoa 2: Dream Champ Tournament takes place sometime after the events of Klonoa: Empire of Dreams. The game begins shortly after Klonoa defeats the King of Despair, and receives an invitation letter that floats from the sky telling him that he has been selected to compete in the prestigious "Dream Champ Tournament" among other accomplished adventurers for the title of "Greatest Hero" as well as a cash reward. After Klonoa finishes reading, he is enveloped in a bright light and finds himself transported inside a gigantic arena alongside several other adventurers. He meets up with Lolo and Popka, only to learn that they are taking part in the competition as well, and a pompous rogue named Guntz who brushes him off immediately. The master of ceremonies, and sponsor of the tournament itself, Garlen, makes his appearance and informs everyone that they will be paired off in a single-elimination tournament that has them racing across several worlds of his own choosing. The first one to reach the end will be the winner and will advance to the next round.

As the third handheld Klonoa game, Dream Champ Tournament plays very similarly to the rest of the games in the series. Using traditional platformer elements, the player can move Klonoa left and right, moving the screen forward as they progress. To defeat enemies, Klonoa will have to use his special weapon, the Wind Bullet, to pull them towards him so he can pick them up. From this position, he can either toss them forward to defeat other enemies, or use them to perform a double-jump to reach places he couldn't normally. In addition, by holding the jump button, Klonoa can flap his large ears to float in place for a short time, which also somewhat increases his jump height or distance.
The game consists of five worlds split into nine small levels called "visions", including a boss level where Klonoa must compete in a foot-race with another adventurer and battle a boss at the same time. One vision is also devoted to a special stage where Klonoa must navigate his hoverboard over water or other terrain while avoiding enemies.
In each vision, there a number of items Klonoa can collect, including exactly 3 stars (Moon Stones), 30 crystals-like objects called "Dream Shards", and one sun-shaped item called a "Sun Stone". The three stars are needed to open the exit door at the end of each vision, but the remaining items are optional. By collecting all 30 Dream Shards, a section of a piece of original artwork is revealed (5 in all, one for each world). If every Sun Stone in the game is collected by the time the player beats it, special stages called "EX Stages" will become available. Beating these new stages has no bearing on the actual game, and are included just for fun.

Source: Wikipedia, "Klonoa 2: Dream Champ Tournament", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121436.name: Kaze no Klonoa: Moonlight Museum
121436.description:
Kaze no Klonoa: Moonlight Museum (風のクロノア ムーンライトミュージアム?, Kaze no Kuronoa Muunraito Myuujiamu, lit. "Klonoa of the Wind: Moonlight Museum") is a video game developed and published by Namco and released exclusively in Japan for the Bandai Wonderswan in 1999. As Klonoa's first handheld adventure, it is the first game in the series to place him in a fully two-dimensional world, and establishes the system that his Game Boy Advance titles will use.

Taking place sometime before Klonoa: Door to Phantomile, Klonoa's first game, Kaze no Klonoa: Moonlight Museum stars Klonoa and his friend Huepow as they come across a young crying girl who tells them that the moon has been divided into fragments and stolen by a mysterious group of artists that reside in the nearby Moonlight Museum. Determined to help, the duo rush off to the Museum's entrance, and once they come inside, they are greeted by a painter named Picoo who traps them inside a piece of artwork. Klonoa and Huepow must fight their way through five worlds within the Museum itself before finding the source of all their troubles and restoring the moon to the sky.

Setting the standard for all the future Klonoa handheld titles, Moonlight Museum displays several standard features for an action sidescroller. The player controls Klonoa as he runs, jumps, and fights his way across several worlds, solving small puzzles in the process. Klonoa defeats enemies by picking them up using a special weapon called the "wind bullet", a ring-shaped object inlaid with a small blue jewel that can fire a small burst of wind straight forward and draw in an enemy, allowing for Klonoa to pick them up over his head. Once he has them, Klonoa can either throw them straight forward, taking out any enemies they happen to hit, or use them to perform a double jump, giving him access to places he otherwise couldn't reach. Also, by holding the jump button, Klonoa can hover in midair for a short duration by flapping his large ears, which also slightly increases his jump distance.
By completing all five worlds and beating the game, Klonoa can access special bonus stages called "EX Stages". These visions are included just for fun, and beating them has no effect on the actual story.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kaze no Klonoa: Moonlight Museum", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121437.name: Gosh, Spies!
121437.description:
From Postmortem's blog preview:

Gosh, Spies! is a supplement for Agents of SWING and will expand the SWING world into the realms of children’s, tweens and teens adventure fiction, drawing on such diverse sources as Enid Blyton, Hanna Barbera and ‘Keene’/'Dixon’ as well as later skits and reinterpretations of the same ideas and characters, giving our own spin on them.

As well as a catalogue of pre-generated characters from these sources you’ll get rules expansions for making youthful characters, rules changes for running child-investigations, suggestion on how to run games for a younger audience – particularly girls and a bunch of background information on SWING’s younger agents, their training and the boarding schools where they teach them to be spies.

Essentially, Gosh, Spies! will provide you with a bunch of characters and villainous organisations suited to the sub-genre (though I’ll try to avoid ‘Gypsies’ as a villainous group) and a whole lot of expansionary material. We thrive on feedback here at Postmortem Studios though and would love you to let us know what material you’d like to see come out for Agents of SWING besides the planned ‘Nefarious’ villains book, Gosh, Spies! and the as-yet-unnamed gadget catalogue.

121438.name: Arbitrary
121438.description:
From the introduction to the game:
The setting in Arbitrary is modern; pretty much everyday stuff. There's no vampires, werewolves, magic,
time-travellers or laspistols. There might be psychics, but only on the end of phone lines and in labratories
in Russia. Crime is a part of soceity, much as it is in real life - there are certain areas you don't go after dark
(or even during the day). The police will beat the crap out of you if you get on their wrong side, or at least
treat you in a rather unpleasant manner. In short, there's absolutely nothing special to it - it's typical actionmovie
fodder, as seen in Die Hard or Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.

121439.name: Untouchable
121439.description:
From Postmortem's blog:

An adventure for Agents of SWING that takes the agents on a chase across Southern Europe and India after a mysterious death is brought to their attention by the Spanish government.

A familiar enemy and a new threat stand against them, each with their own ideology but are they truly allies and can SWING prevent the revolution going nuclear?

121440.name: Starfall Forest
121440.description:
The fairies desperately want to return to their home among the stars. For this they need stardust (the lifeforce of fairies) and what better place to find it than in Starfall Forest?

Every now and then a star will come falling down into the forest where the fairies are hiding and waiting. As soon as a stars lands, the fairies are eager to get to it. Moving from tree to tree, as fairies prefer to stay hidden from sight, they all try to get to the star as quickly as possible. Only when a fairy has collected enough stardust can she make it back home to the stars.

So the race to the stars is on! But beware.. There are venomous snakes about. Try not to get bit as this will cost you the precious stardust you so desperately need to go back home.

All fairies will eventually manage to return home, clever as they are. But who will get there first?

121441.name: Les Ripoux
121441.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game adaptation of the French movie "Les Ripoux": http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0088002/

You are a crooked cop, and your goal is to make enough money to buy a PMU (a pub where you can bet on horse races), without getting caught by the IGS (the police branch investigating police corruption cases). That means investigating cases and arresting criminals in order to raise your administrative grades, and at the same time organizing protection rackets and looking for lucrative opportunities.

121442.name: Icewind Dale + Heart of Winter + Trials of the Luremaster
121442.description:
User Summary

Full release of Icewind Dale which contains:
-Icewind Dale
-Icewind Dale: Heart of Winter
-Trials of Luremaster - additional quest for advanced characters

121443.name: Holocauste
121443.description:
User Summary

Holocauste is a post-apocalyptic graphical text adventure game. When the atomic bombs fell, you and three fellow scientists went into hibernation in an underground shelter. Four years later, the facility's computer wakes you up: the cryogenic system's CPU is fried, and the atomic reactor powering the shelter is almost out of fuel. You have no choice but to journey to the surface, find a replacement processor and fuel cartridges and come back. You have two hours: after that, the life support systems will shut down and your colleagues will die.

121444.name: Silva
121444.description:
User Summary

This graphical adventure game is the sequel of Infernal House, and the last adventure game Lankhor produced for the Amstrad CPC.

The back of the box says (translated from French):

"Relive the atmosphere of Infernal House through this new investigation:
a strange dream... a woman tells me: I am dead now but I can still talk to you. You who destroyed all I had done, you must help me find my body back and I'll tell you everything.
If you fail, you'll all die.
Go, and when you wake up, you'll know the way."

121445.name: Dan Silver
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
121445.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game, by the same authors as Holocauste (also from MBC informatique).

The back of the box says (translated from French):
"Earth, 2020. Something very bad is happening: most of the population dies, with no apparent cause. Nations are unable to deal with this plague.

A renowned scientist establishes that whatever is killing the population comes from a previously unknown planet.

He asks his friend DAN SILVER to help him solve the mystery, but dies before meeting him.

You are DAN SILVER.

The fate of humanity, or what's left of it, is in your hands."

121447.name: Agro's Maze
121447.description:
User Summary

Agro’s Maze is a puzzle maze game for the iPhone and iPad. You take the role of Agro, a cute alien from outer space who just arrived to Earth and your goal is to reach the Big Moon Bean.

121448.name: Flick Sheep
121448.description:
A Challenging Brain Puzzler!

Move your sheep around and about to clear stages and finish the game. Make sure you use your head! With help from Sheepdog and Collie make sure your sheep get home safely...all before the sun goes down.

Source: The Game Website.

121449.name: Alien Hordes
121449.description:
User Summary

In Alien Hordes you need to defend yourself from strange aliens who want only to eat you. They hide in the darkness of space and they are destroying everything they encounter in their path. You only have your Hunter-Dragon starship to kill them.

121450.name: Angry Cannon
121450.description:
User Summary

Angry Cannon is a very addicting defense game. You only have one cannon to defend the island from boats and boats of pirates. The game features more than 20 different enemies, 40 challenging levels and more than 10 kind of weapons to destroy them.

121451.name: Gaia Saga Universal Role-Playing System Core Rulebook (2nd Edition)
121451.description:
From RPG description here on RPGGeek:
Gaia Saga is a universal role playing system designed to be as flexible as possible for its players so that they can have a unique and truly original experience each time they start a new game. This rulebook contains everything you need to play, and has many features unavailable in more popular commercial games. Give it a try and see how Gaia Saga measures up.

Gaia Saga offers rich and detailed rules for every niche of gaming and can easily be converted into any number of different types of games. Its flexibility lies in its dice system, one which allows you to combine different forms of dice together so that you can far exceed a single D20. This system allows characters to continue to grow more powerful and skillful, meaning that they can exceed the limits of mortal men and women and can become legendary beings in the Mortal Realm, possibly even rivaling those of the Gods themselves.

This is a universal system, and can be used as basis for other game ideas such as Sci-Fi, Horror, Super Hero, Fan-Based such as movie adventures or anime, or any number of possibilities.

121452.name: The Cogs of War
121452.description: User Summary: First sourcebook for the Gaia Saga roleplaying game. Provides new combat, magic and religious options.

121453.name: Polaris 1st Edition
121453.description:
In the far future, Earth has undergone a series of disasters that has made impossible, for humans, life on the surface. What remains of the lands is swept by incessant storms, maelstroms of energy and radioactive fields.
The world is now populated with giant predators, festering insects and carnivorous plants which reign on a desolate world.

121454.name: Veilig Verkeer Spel
121454.description:
An educational card game published by the Dutch Safe Traffic Agency, meant for teaching and checking knowledge of Dutch traffic rules and regulations.

Game contains a to-be-assembled die, cut-out chits and playing cards.

Per round the top card is drawn and a die roll decides which category question or task must be correctly answered to win that category's chit.
Each card contains three traffic rules questions, a pictionary-like assignment (traffic-related: draw a traffic light) and charade-like task (mime turning right on a bike). Each question or task has its own category. The game should be played by teams of at least two players. The team who first collects all 5 different category chits wins.

121455.name: Admiral of the Black
121455.description:
Admiral of the Black is set in the Golden Age of Piracy. It is both a board game and a deck building game. Players take the roles of pirate captains and compete against each other by raiding merchant ships for trade goods and treasure that earn them Victory Points. They also must visit friendly ports to trade goods, add new crew members, and purchase arms and equipment. These new crew members, arms, and equipment cards are added to their decks.

The board is a map of the Caribbean with a hexagonal grid. Players move on the edges of the hexes while the merchant ships move from one hex to the next. A player may engage a ship in battle when its ship is on a hex edge adjacent to a merchant ship. Once an enemy ship is defeated in naval combat the player may initiate boarding combat.

Both naval and boarding combat are resolved through the player's Naval Combat and Boarding Combat decks. An additional six-sided die is added to the combat score.

The game ends when the Admiral of the Black (the leader of the pirates) is defeated and a new Admiral of the Black is declared by the player with the most Victory Points.

121457.name: Pirates
121457.description:
"Replace my right hand by one of their technological toys? Never!
Nothing is better than a good old hook to quell a balky cabin boy.
And at least, it's enduring, it rocks and it does not fail.
Everyone can see that I've fought, I'm not a weakling.
If I lose an eye, I'll not replace it, it's an honour to lose an eye in battle.
Then all this stuff they graft instead, it's not good...
It brings bad luck."

Statement by Gellor the Cripple, after his capture by the Watchers

121459.name: Bass Ackwards
121459.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It’s the game where the right answer is wrong! Teams start at the finish space and try not to get to start. Read the answer that’s on the card, then read the three questions below it. Try to select one of the two WRONG questions. If you do, you stay where you are on the game board – but if you pick the correct question, you move closer to start.

121460.name: Meurtre A Grande Vitesse
121460.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game set aboard a TGV (Train à Grande Vitesse, France's express trains). French senator Perignace has been murdered aboard the train, and it's up to you to discover the killer.

The game was sold in a video cassette box and contained several clues usable in the game, such as a coded message, a BASIC program listing, a hair pin, several notes (including one written in german), a business card...

121462.name: Aurora (Volume 4, Issue 2 - March 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Black Talons in RPG Land - Part 1

121463.name: Aurora (Volume 4, Issue 3 - May 2010)
rpgissuearticle: The Butchers Bill: Requiem of an Overlord

121465.name: Aurora (Volume 4, Issue 5 - Sept 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Steps to Forming a Large Force

121466.name: Aurora (Volume 4, Issue 6 - Nov 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Introduction to the Northern Military Police & Military Patrol Commands

121467.name: Booklet of the Empress
rpgpodcastepisode: Steve Long talks about Book of the Empress Kickstarter
121467.description:
From the Introduction

The characters in this PDF are being provided as a reward to everyone who backed the Kickstarter for The Book Of The Empress. Thank you all so much for your support!

These characters were created by Steven S. Long, the author of BotE, but the ideas for them were provided by Kickstarter backers who pledged $150 or more. Each of them is identified with the character he inspired, and we’d particularly like to thank these backers for their generous contributions to the BotE cause.

The following characters appear in this title...

The Battalioneers: Astra, Bo’am Yaar, Falkenrath, Magenta Shadow, Mind Phantom, Prism Guardian, Solomon, Sunburn, The Traveler, & Turanda.

Bonus Crusaders of the Infinite Realities: Crystal Warrior Mirai, Gargun the Seeker, Lord Fracta, & Karama Talis.

Also included are full character sheets for the members of the Crusaders of the Infinite Realities as described on pages 192-93 of The Book of the Empress.

121468.name: Adventurer's Option: Strained and Battered
121468.description:
Publisher's description:

Torrok shook under the mighty blow. The battles had been raging on all day, and the minotaur he now faced was not the first he'd fought that day - and who knew if it would be the last. He'd never known himself able to push his endurance and resilience to such limits. If he survived only a single night of rest would await him before the battle was rejoined. With grim certainty he knew, come tomorrow, that the strain of today would still bear heavy upon him.

When an adventurer is pushed to their limits, there is a price to pay! Add to your games a level of hindrance to a character's health and recovery. Inside this 4e supplement you'll find rules that provide a noticeable in-game impact to a brutal day of action while at the same time not penalizing characters to a degree where they no longer function or become incredibly cautious. Built upon the concepts and rules structures of the base 4e game, it introduces new dimensions of knife-edge play while shying away from explicit injuries, wound tracking and additional game complexity.

You will like playing with this product if...


You want a character's physical condition at the end of the adventuring day to mean something
You yearn for more grittiness in your game
You dislike the "1 HP to full" nature of Extended Rest healing
You enjoy added game intricacy without added complexity
You are looking for additional rules support that is built upon the systems already in the game for easy integration

121469.name: Adventurer's Option: Tauric Races
121469.description:
Publisher's description:

Centaurs – mention their name and familiar images are likely to spring to mind of the powerful half-human, half-horse hybrids. From that basic typology other creatures have leapt into the fantasy scene, fusing animals of all types and stripes (or spots) into the familiar ‘tauric form. From horses to goats to lions to dragons to snakes to even spiders, numerous ‘tauric creatures have appeared within D&D and elsewhere over the years.

Bring those fantastic ‘taur races, both the familiar and the new, into your 4th Edition game with this rules supplement! Inside you’ll find rules that provide all you need to create a ‘tauric race for inclusion within any campaign, in any adventuring party and at any starting level. Using a series of generic race templates the rules allow for the creation any number of ‘tauric races, using nearly any animal type as a baseline from the small to the large, from the equine to the insect, and everything in between. Let your imagination envision what you want and add it to your campaign. Built upon the concepts and rules structures of the base 4e game, it introduces a bevy of new race, game and role playing options while avoiding extra complexity.

You will like playing with this product if...


You love ‘taurs and want to play a ‘tauric race
You want to include ‘tauric races in your campaign
You don’t want to be limited in the races you can create: centaurs, liontaurs, foxtaurs, dracotaurs, beetletaurs, and more!
You enjoy added game intricacy without added complexity
You are looking for additional rules support that is built upon the systems already in the game for easy integration

121470.name: News Hole
121470.description:
From the publisher's website:

News Hole is a structured freeform game about a family in crisis and the death of print journalism.

121471.description:
In 1982, Mexico's economy collapsed, and the government's response was to centralize the banks and devalue the peso. (This much, at least, is true...)

In the game world of Banditos, the Mexican people responded poorly to these changes, resulting in a decrease in effective security and an increase in creative accounting at the new Banco de Mexico. Once some of the "alternatively principled" people in the land of opportunity heard about this, they looked south of the border for their ventures.

You will play one of several American characters making runs into Mexico to pull bank heists. You will need to acquire vehicles, weapons, seed money, and maybe even some inside information to make it all happen.

The first player to get his character home with the equivalent of one million US dollars wins.

Players can acquire cards (vehicles etc.) by drawing them each turn, by buying them from other players, or by stealing them from the discard pile.

Doing anything deemed illegal, however, will bring "heat" to your character (if you steal from the discard pile or pull a heist,) or your vehicle (if you steal gas or pull a heist,) or Mexican cities (if you pull a heist.)
It's up to you as a player to manage your risk and decide how desperate you are to acquire what you need versus how much heat you currently have.

If you have the guts to try a risky heist, it'll either pay off or you'll land in a Mexican jail and have to play catch-up.
121471.name: Banditos

121472.name: Matchlocks on the Warpath
121472.description:
Subtitled: Skirmish Rules for the Early Gunpowder Era

Mainly for recreating small conflicts during the settling of America. Also can be used to simulate actions in Europe, pirates and Colonial conflicts.

For skirmish combat between up to 80 figures per side. A figure represents one character. Each player command one or two units of 5-10 characters.

Units are activated randomly using cards, then the unit leader consumes Activation Points to make soldiers act.

A ring-bound booklet of 22 pages with a cardstock cheat sheet.
Eleven sample units and Optional rules are provided as Appendix.

121473.name: Taiga 3rd Edition
121473.description:
Taiga 3rd Edition / International Version

From the back cover
The Western Civilization has failed. The modern world has collapsed into barbarism, over which two superpowers, on the brink of global nuclear war, snarl at each other. 92% of the population are "statistical surplus population" that doesn't even exist in the eyes of the law. Happy New Year world. 2039AD is going to be a killer.

In a land called Taiga rich people live in isolated and well-protected Central Sectors. A sea of anarchy surrounds these islands of stability. Roadgangs, streetgangs, terrorists, mafia, emerging mutated species and devil-worshipping cultists are fighting for power. And the ecocatastrophe runs rampant, drowning the once-fertile lands of the northern hemisphere into salty sand.
They build cybernetic eyes in Tokyo but light their cigarettes with flint and steel in Karaganda. Technology is marching backwards. But according to the politicians, there is no risk at all, 2039 will be just another triumphant year for the Western Civilization.

From page 123
A list of future products was added in the following order (note that no product numbers were assigned)
Sweet Home Karaganda
Raider's Handbook
Witchdrum of Denim

Note: International Version was only released in North America and was published by Renaissance Ink for Burger Games.

121474.name: Lezen &cetera
121474.description:
A Rummy-like card game with World Literature as theme. Each card represents a famous book from the World Literature, including a (colored) theme, and a short description with highlighted keywords. Players try and lay combinations of cards based on the colored theme (beginners), the keywords in the description (intermediate), or self-defined connections between the books (advanced).

Designed by Dutch writer and journalist Pieter Steinz.

121475.name: Ryzykanci: Koleje Fortuny
121475.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Discovering the tradition of the 19th-century Mazovia region via a card game? Why not! Ryzykanci: Koleje Fortuny (Daredevils: Wheels of Fortune) presents the time of revolutionary industrial changes, political storms, building fortunes, and the first steps of the capitalistic society in Poland. The rail played an important role at that time; it revolutionized transportation, production and trade. Welcome to Mazovia, the world of industrialists, tycoons, magnates and patrons – in other words, daredevils.

In the game you take a role of a famous Polish industrailist from the 19th century and develop your company. The goal of the game is to achieve the highest number of prestige points. Players may gather prestige points through buying shares, building investments (such as Train Stations, Theaters or Boarding Schools) and collecting cash.

The box contains: 110 cards, 16 wood markers and a rulebook with an educational brochure.

The game was prepared for the Mazovian Center of Culture and Art.

121476.name: Fahrt ins All
121476.description:
This east German game simulates the cosmonaut's training that supposedly boys were always dreaming about.
The first half of the game is a snakes and ladders part: Players roll dice and move ahead the strenuous training path. On some fields, they are allowed to move ahead fast because of "excellent performances", other field lets them fall behind for "insufficient performances". When a player reaches the 30th field of the track, his or her plastic cosmonaut is inserted into a plastic rocket and is ready for take-off. After rolling a six, the rocket is moved along a path to a distant planet, and the game turns into a basic roll and move game. After skipping a turn on the planet, players take off again and reach earth again on a different path. The first player to return home safely is the winner.

The game is free of political agitation and focusses on the hardships of the cosmonaut's training. It is remarkable that this ancient game (which has only two pages of rules anyway) contains a rule overview on the back side of the rule booklet.

121477.name: Weapon Focus: Riot Control
121477.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weapon Focus: Riot Control provides alternate statistics and rules for the use of weapons designed to non-lethally subdue opponents.

New Weapon Stats

NEW stats are included for Tear Gas, Pepper Spray, Rubber Bullets, Bean Bag Guns and Tasers, updated with realism and usability in mind.

Weapon History

A brief history of tear gas, pepper spray, rubber bullets, bean bag guns and tasers.

121478.name: Librum Equitis, Volume I (First Edition)
121478.description:
From Introduction:

22 Prestige Classes, ladies and gentlemen.

Nothing more, nothing less.

All carefully hand-crafted from the finest D20 components, and playtested through gruelling combats and intense role-playing by D20 gamers world-wide, to make sure that you get the finest in kickass D20 Prestige Classes.

Sure, that means no art, no sample characters, etc... but it also means minimal cost to you. (It 's not like we didn't TRY to include art... but after three cont racts with various artist fell through, we decided releasing this was more important than waiting for the pictures to arrive - if you would like to illustrate our future products, contact us at Ambient Inc.)

121480.name: Street Fighter Alpha Anthology
videogamehonor: 2006 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
121480.description:
Street Fighter Alpha Anthology, released in Japan as Street Fighter Zero: Fighters' Generation, is a 2006 fighting game compilation that collects the Street Fighter Alpha series (Street Fighter Alpha, Street Fighter Alpha 2 and Street Fighter Alpha 3). The game also includes a remixed version of the console-exclusive Street Fighter Alpha 2 Gold and Super Gem Fighter Mini Mix (previously released on the PlayStation as Pocket Fighter), as well as two secret games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Fighter Alpha Anthology", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

121481.name: Operation Blast
121481.description:
Operation Blast is a game of economic and military strategy, playing with cards. You are president of a small republic at war with its neighbors. Thanks to the financial resources you have, you can afford the services of foreign powers to fight the battle.

Your territory, such as your enemies is divided into 10 provinces, materialized by tokens. In different ways, you can destroy your enemies provinces, they can destroy yours, you can rebuild, and they also. When a player's 10 provinces are destroyed, it is eliminated. The last player to have at least one province has won the war.

Apart from the money, there are four types of cards: the production units, combat units, units of action and events. These units belong to foreign powers grouped into five categories: United States, Europe, Eastern Countries, Asia and Arab countries. Depending on the money you have, you can afford the services of these units.

Combat units, such as production units, are placed on the territory of the player. For that, each time he places a card, he must pay the recruitment fee or purchase price, either by using profits from its production, either with cash it may have on hand.

Each unit can only move once per turn. They can either join a production unit to support his defense, or to regroup them (maximum 3 units can be grouped ) or go to war: for this, the player must pay the travel expenses, and the unit then join the combat zone, a "no man's land" in the center of the table. When your opponent has no more unity in the combat zone or to protect his territory , each time you attack him, your attack will destroy a province...

121482.name: Imps Vs Puppies: Hissy Fits
121482.description:
The first expansion to the trick taking game of puppy smashing chaos, Hissy Fits introduces 8 new Imps and the dangerous new Ninja Kittens to the crate decks.

New character abilities run the gamut from resurrecting dead imps, stopping other abilities from triggering, even reversing the order of strength for the round. Once upon a time, not winning a round was at least a little safe but the new Ninja Kitten spring from their smashed crates and kill the weakest Imp in the round.

All the additions are specifically designed to make this game tougher and more strategic, obviously players experienced in Imps Vs Puppies need apply. This expansion requires the base game to be played.

121483.name: Heimot
rpgissuearticle: Heimot - Suomalainen scifi-peli ison maailman malliin
121483.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heimot on synkkäsävyinen avaruusoopperaroolipeli, jossa tiede, teknologia ja mystiikka kohtaavat. Pelin sankarit ovat klaanittomia – kartettuja ja pelättyjä hylkiöitä – joiden kohtalo kätkee avaimet ihmiskunnan tulevaisuuteen.

Pelikirjasta löydät:

Laajan kuvauksen pelimaailmasta
Helposti opittavat ja joustavat n10-pohjaiset säännöt (tarvitset pelataksesi 1 - 3 kymmentahoista noppaa)
Pistepohjaisen hahmonluonnin ja kehityksen
120 hahmoja elävöittävää Taustapiirrettä




From the back of the book (translated from finnish):

Heimot is an epic science fiction roleplaying game where science, technology and mysticism meet each other in a dark world of tomorrow. Heroes of the game as clanless - feared and avoided outcasts - whose destiny holds the keys for future of mankind.

121484.name: Swiss Cheese
121484.description:
The box says "An Exciting 3 Dimensional Game." Aimed at children under eight years old.

It is a race to see who can get through their 'cheese tunnel' first. Luck and colour recognition are all part of the race.

The tiles are placed face down. Players draw a tile - If it matches their colour they can move their mouse along the tunnel. If it is not their colour, return it to the pack. There are penalties for drawing a cat card.

The first player to get their mouse to the end of the cheese tunnel, wins.

Contents
4 - 3D Cheese Tunnels
4 Mice Holes
4 Mice
24 Mice and Cat Tiles.
1 Cat Backcloth.
1 Set of Rules.

121485.name: Strange Salads
121485.description: Party game. Each guest receives a question card. The game takes the form of a quiz where all the answers relate in some way to something used to maka a salad. The guest who gets most right, wins.

121486.name: Librum Equitis, Volume 2
121486.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Respected Class are back again, with another collection of prestige classes for your fantasy D20 campaign, all lovingly handcrafted from the best D20 components and playtested to a fine edge. From Yuan-Ti converts and spies, Bardic College spies, and the Blessed Paladin who embodies the warrior aspect of his deity, be it good or evil, to the Mad Tailor who crafts strange constructs from living things and the Tribal Berserker who becomes a lycanthrope while raging. Prestige classes for every occasion, every class, and every villain.

20 Prestige Classes:

Bokor
Bone Archer
Brotherhood of the Golden Blossom
Children of the Snake
Circle of the Lute
Earthbound
Elite Cavalry
Forge Singer
Mad Tailor
Mind Thief
Order of Cordun
Riders of the Duras
Sacred Paladin
Siege Mage
The Society of Heavenly Movements
Timer
Tribal Berserker
Troll Hunter
Venomous
Weapon Cult Paragon




8 Clerical Domains, a bunch of new spells and some psionic items usable in any (even non-psionic) campaign round out the book. Slipped in here and there are a new poison, new monsters and some new feats too.

121487.name: Travel Battlehits
121487.description: Each player deploys his ships secretly on a square grid. Then each player shoots at the other's grid by calling a location. The defender responds by "Hit!" or "Miss!". You try to deduce where the enemy ships are and sink them. First to do so wins. It is extremely similar to the popular game Battleship, the difference being this version uses a pen and paper grid instead of the peg-board found in that game.

121488.name: Pot-Shot
121488.description:
Shooting target game not without some humour.

Players take turns shooting at an array of three targets; a pheasant in flight, a duck wading and a gamekeeper reloading his gun. If you hit the pheasant you score 15 points; if you hit the duck you get 10 points, but if you hit the gamekeeper (oops!), you lose 5 points.

First to score a pre-set total of points, wins.

121489.name: Robin Hood Shooting Game
121489.description:
A shooting target game featuring famous images associated with the Outlaw of Sherwood Forest.

The target has four characters. Two mounted Normans and two unmounted knights. I think the mounted character in plain clothes so-to-speak is probably the dastardley Sheriff of Nottingham.

Each player takes turns and the one who has the most successes after a pre-agreed number of rounds, wins.

121490.name: The Askalite
121490.description:
Traditional quiz game where a player must answer a question by placing the wired connector to the slot of his chosen answer and, if correct, the bulb attached to that answer will light up. Subjects provided are:
Who was, Where is, Translate, History, General Knowledge and one which asked you to write your own questions and answers.
Most correct answers, wins.

Instructions from the rules:
Connect the two wires to a battery - one player should place one of the perforated sheets so that the holes in it fit exactly over the little knobs. Players in turn take the left wander-plug and with it touch any one of the knobs on the question side (the left), then try to find the right answer on the right hand side. If the player thinks he has found the correct reply, the right hand plug should be placed in contact with the knob in the square which he thinks contains the correct answer. When the correct answer is found, the lamp light up.

121491.name: The New Game of Aerial Puff Ball
121491.description:
A twist on the mechanics used in Blow Football games but this time a lot more abstract and aimed at adults (judging by the image on the box).

This is probably an original Edwardian Parlour Game. The box is placed in the middle of the table with the cup fixed upon the post in the centre. Each player takes a blower (8 included), and placing the coloured balls one by one in the end of it, endeavours to blow them into the box. Each player in turn puffs all the balls, and scores the numbers of the divisions into which they fall. A ball resting in the Cup counts as 25.

The game is won by the player who first scores 50 or 100, as may be agreed when starting.

121492.name: Tiddly Hoop
121492.description:
A tiddlywink variant that requires a lot of tiddle on your wink.

Between the player and the scoring board is a three-dimensional clown illustration. The clown is holding up a hoop. To score anything the player must launch a counter tiddlywink fashion, up through the hoop and then onto the board. I suggest this was quite difficult to accomplish first time.

At the back of the board there is a score board where you can record your successes. First to the end of the scoreboard track, wins

121493.name: Battle Shock
121493.description:
"In a world where ruthless marauders attack the innocent, where violence and evil threaten at every turn, there is only YOU. You are the last hope of every villager behind your castle walls. It is up to you to protect them from the onslaught of terror brought by the Hordes of Evil. You can stop them … in the world of BATTLE SHOCK."

Source: The Developer Website.

121494.name: Tour of Switzerland
121494.description:
A simple game linked to all things Swiss.

Each player is given 12 counters, 2 of which are put into a pool. The throw of a die determines how far you move. When landing on a numbered square, the player refers to the list of places corresponding with the number and pays to or receives from the pool, the numbers of counters stated.
When landing on a mountain pass - You must pay 1 counter to all other players. Customs squares will cost you 3 Counters!

The player who first reaches or passes No. 132 Basle and takes the pool, and the winner is the one with most counters.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Playing Pieces.
Large Amount of Counters.
1 Die.
1 Set of Rules.

121495.name: Bongbong Boom
121495.description:
User Summary

BongBong Boom is a puzzle game in the vein of Bejeweled. You need to mine deep in the earth to claim treasure, the innovative aspect of the game is that you can increase the critical point of the bombs and they transmit their powerful explosion to other bombs creating a chain reaction.

121496.name: Ett himla liv
121496.description:
From the Introduction:

Det du håller i handen är ett Grymt Innovativt Roligt Litet Spel! Dessa rollspel, som samlas under förkortningen GIRLS, är kompletta och står för sig själva, men är också kompatibla med varandra. Man kan spela vart och ett av dem för sig, eller blanda friskt med rollpersoner från alla GIRLS-spel i samma kampanj. Samtliga GIRLS-spel använder regelsystemet KYSS, mest känt från rollspelet Playelf, och handlar om övernaturliga tonårstjejer av en eller annan sort.

Ett Himla Liv är det första spelet i GIRLSserien. I denna lättsamma spel i den episka sagan tar spelarna rollen av änglar som skickats ner till jorden för att få en vettig skolgång. Naturligtvis är livet som ängel inte helt lätt: killar, dejter, tjejsnack, läxor, nationella prov, studenthemmets föreståndarinna, otäcka demoner, partyn, klasskamrater, Hin Håles underhuggare och annat trubbel väntar runt om varje hörn.

För att inte tala om hur man gömmer undan änglavingar med vingspann på två meter i omklädningsrummet på gympan...

Du behöver en helt vanlig sexsidig tärning för att spela Ett Himla Liv eller de andra spelen i GIRLS-serien.


User Translation:

What you hold in your hand is a Great Innovative Rules Light System! These role-playing games, which are known by the acronym GIRLS, are complete and standalone, but are also compatible with one another. You can play each of them individually, or mix freely with the role of people from all GIRLS games in the same campaign. All GIRLS-games use the KISS rules system, best known from the role-playing game Playelf, and deals with supernatural teenage girls of one sort or another.

A Heavenly Life is the first game in the Girls Series. In this light-hearted game in the epic saga players take the role of angels sent down to Earth to get a decent schooling. Of course, life as angel is not that easy: boys, dating, girl talk, homework, national tests, student home matron, nasty demons, parties, classmates, Hin Håles underling and other troubles are waiting around every corner.

To say nothing of how to hide the angel wings with a wingspan of two metres in the gym changing room...

You need an ordinary six-sided dice to play A Heavenly Life or the other games in the GIRLS series.

121497.name: Bombard
121497.description:
"Bombard delivers the ultimate of arcade experiences where all your timing, aiming & destruction needs will be fulfilled. Using different types of ammunition you’ll pass each of the game´s stages either by hitting targets, destroying objects or by solving puzzles. From its simple unlocking system levels may be played whenever time is right, making Bombard a true pick-up-and-play type of game."

Source: The Developer Website.

121498.name: Pohjanmaan Tähti
121498.description:
The goal of the game is to find a gem from Finnish province called Ostrobothnia.

Players roll a die and move their button forward trying to find a gem called Star of Ostrobothnia. During the trip players flip tokens and cannot know what they will find. Players can crash to the knife, which is humorically a some kind of symbol of Ostrobothnia, and have to answer a question which asks knowledge of Southern Ostrobothnia. Players can open a token with a gallant hat and it amuses with aphorisms and grumbles. Players can also drift to a prison with Isoontalon Antti and Rannanjärvi, which are famous characters of Ostrobothnia.

In the game players move their buttons in earth, sea and air.

121499.name: VS4
121499.description:
User Summary

VS4 is a budget clone of Marble Madness. Lead your sphere through each the levels while avoiding enemies and dodging the many hazards.

121500.name: Not An Acronym D6
121500.description:
From the Introduction to v1.1:

Welcome to Not An Acronym D6. This is a roleplaying game system meant for, uh, roleplaying. Other games have cutesy acronyms for their names, but not NAA! It's got a downright horrible name. NAA began as a "Spirits of Eden" RPG system. I later realized I would rather make it a more generic system. I designed this system because I wanted to play it. I was feeling a bit dry of feeling for other RPG games so I thought I'd make my own. I thought I would also provide it for free to anyone on my site, so they could play it too if they wanted.

What sets NAA apart from other games? Nothing in particular. This game does not have wiz-bang artwork, laser-guided exception-based design, "old school" design principles that challenge players instead of characters, nor skills and rules for every possible situation, no revolutionary story-gaming design principles, advanced player input technology that allows story to develop throughout play, or quirky dice mechanics never before unleashed upon an unsuspecting public. It does, however, have six sided dice, so it delivers upon the one thing promised by the name. No other dice will ever into this relationship, and you will not have to buy any props in order to play the game. So at the very least, it is a very cheap game to play.
